eligibility_criteria: Individuals/ societies/ self-help groups/ associations/ reservoir monopolies/ private units etc. involved in inland fisheries activities can avail the benefits of inland schemes.The applicant should be a Fisherman.The applicant should belong to the Schedule Tribe(ST) category.Applicant should be above 18 years of age.The beneficiary fisherman must have his own bank account.
required_documents: Aadhaar card.Quotation.Caste certificate.Passport size photo.Bank passbook/cancelled cheque.Ration card.

faqs.question: What is the objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The purpose of the scheme is to increase fish production through inland fisheries and provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Tribe (ST) individuals involved in fish farming and fishing activities.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Individuals, societies, self-help groups, associations, reservoir monopolies, and private units engaged in inland fisheries are eligible. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category, be at least 18 years old, and have a valid bank account.

faqs.question: Can an individual from the Scheduled Caste (SC) category apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is exclusively for Scheduled Tribe (ST) individuals involved in inland fisheries.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is provided for fish seed rearing?
faqs.answer:
The scheme offers financial assistance for fish seed rearing as follows:

₹90/- per 1000 spawn to fry with a 30% minimum recovery.
₹260/- per 1000 fry to fingerlings with a 35% minimum recovery.
₹460/- per 1000 spawn to fingerlings with a 12% minimum recovery.

faqs.question: How much financial support is provided for fish seed rearing by women?
faqs.answer: Women will receive ₹90/- per 1000 spawn, with a minimum 30% recovery from spawn to fry.

faqs.question: Does the scheme provide assistance for fish seed stocking?
faqs.answer: Yes, 100% assistance is provided to Scheduled Caste (SC) beneficiaries for the cost of fish seed and transportation.

faqs.question: Is there support available for prawn seed stocking?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme provides 100% assistance to Scheduled Caste (SC) lessees for the total cost of prawn seed and transportation.

faqs.question: What assistance is available for purchasing boats and nets?
faqs.answer:
50% assistance is provided for Tin Boat & Net, up to ₹7,500/-.
50% assistance is provided for F.R.P. Boat & Net, up to ₹15,000/-.

faqs.question: Are training programs available under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, Scheduled Tribe (ST)) trainees receive a scholarship of ₹2,000/- per month for three months. A trainee is eligible for the scholarship only on the basis of a minimum 60% attendance.

faqs.question: What is the minimum time limit for reclaiming benefits?
faqs.answer:
The minimum time limit varies:

Fish seed rearing & stocking: 1 year.
Boat & net assistance: 6 years.
Fish cage culture: 3 years.
Training of tribal trainees: Once in a lifetime.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant must apply online through the i-Khedut portal (https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in) and upload the necessary documents.

name: Livestock Health and Diseases Control
description: Objectives To implement Critical Animal disease control programme to eradicate PPR by 2030 by vaccinating all sheep and goats and to control Classical Swine Fever (CSF) by vaccinating the entire pig population To provide veterinary services at the farmers’ doorstep through Mobile Veterinary Units (MVUs) To assist States/UTs for Control of Animal Disease (ASCAD) by prevention & control of important livestock and poultry diseases prevalent in different States / UTs as per the State /UT’s priorities.﻿The LH&DC scheme covers a following activities:Prophylactic vaccination programmes against various livestock and poultry diseases.Disease surveillance and early detection.Control and eradication of livestock diseases.Capacity building of veterinary personnel.Strengthening of veterinary infrastructure.﻿Critical Animal Disease Control Programme Peste des Petits Ruminants Eradication Programme (PPR-EP).Classical Swine Fever Control Programme (CSF-CP).﻿Scheme Implementation Strategy State / UT to identify and designate suitable agency as SIA / LDB (preferably same as in NADCP).State / UT / SIA shall develop further guidelines for implementation of the Scheme delineating roles and responsibilities of all functionaries at different levels.
state: Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
benefits: Improved animal health and productivity: To protect livestock from diseases

which leads to improved animal health and productivity.Reduced economic losses: To reduce economic losses to farmers due to livestock diseases.Improved food security: To improve food security by ensuring a steady supply of livestock products.Increased employment opportunities: To increased employment opportunities in the livestock sector.Improved rural livelihood: To improve the livelihoods of rural people who depend on livestock for their income.
eligibility_criteria: Beneficiary must be a bona fide farmer or livestock owner.Beneficiary must have a valid livestock ownership document.Beneficiary's livestock must be used for commercial purposes.
required_documents: An application form.A copy of your Aadhaar card or other identity proof.A copy of your livestock ownership documents.

faqs.question: What is this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Livestock Health and Diseases Control (LH&DC) scheme is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS) implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying (DAHD), Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare, Government of India.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer:
1. Improved animal health and productivity.
2. Reduced economic losses.
3. Improved food security.
4. Increased employment opportunities.
5. Improved rural livelihood.

faqs.question: Who can get the scheme benefits
faqs.answer:
1. Beneficiary must be a bona fide farmer or livestock owner.
2. Beneficiary must have a valid livestock ownership document.
3. Beneficiary's livestock must be used for commercial purposes.

faqs.question: What activities are cover under the scheme?
faqs.answer:
1. Prophylactic vaccination programmes against various livestock and poultry diseases.
2. Disease surveillance and early detection.
3. Control and eradication of livestock diseases.
4. Capacity building of veterinary personnel.
5. Strengthening of veterinary infrastructure.

faqs.question: What is the application process ?
faqs.answer:
1. Contact local veterinary office or the Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying in state.
2. Fill out the application form and submit it to the concerned authority, along with the required documents.

faqs.question: What documents are required ?
faqs.answer:
1. An application form. 
2. A copy of your Aadhaar card or other identity proof.
3. A copy of your livestock ownership documents.

name: Fodder Minikits under Tribal Area Sub Plan (TASP) Scheme (ST Category)
description: The scheme “Fodder Minikits under Tribal Area Sub Plan (TASP) Scheme” is implemented by the Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat. Under this scheme, improved varieties of fodder seeds are provided to beneficiaries for widespread publicity, demonstration and adaptation by farmers.
benefits: Under this scheme
the fodder seed minikit of 3 Kg
7 Kg or 10 Kg is given to the eligible beneficiary.
eligibility_criteria: The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Gujarat.The beneficiary of the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category can avail the benefit under this scheme.The beneficiary should possess 10 Guntha of land to his or her name.
required_documents: 1.	Identity proof2.	Proof of Residence3.	Proof of possessing10 Guntha of land4.	Any other documents as required

faqs.question: Who implements this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare, and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible beneficiaries receive fodder seed minikits of 3 Kg, 7 Kg, or 10 Kg.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Permanent residents of Gujarat, particularly those belonging to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category, are eligible.

faqs.question: Are there any land ownership requirements for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, the beneficiary should possess at least 10 Guntha of land in their name.

faqs.question: How can I avail myself of this scheme?
faqs.answer: You can avail the benefits by contacting a nearby Veterinary dispensary or First Aid Veterinary Centre.

faqs.question: Are there any specific types of fodder seeds provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, improved varieties of fodder seeds are provided to beneficiaries.

name: "Back Ended Investment Subsidy to Paddy Growers" component of the "Crop Production Technology" scheme
description: The "Back Ended Investment Subsidy to Paddy Growers" component of the "Crop Production Technology" scheme was introduced by the Department of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, the paddy farmers residing in the Yanam region are provided a back-ended investment subsidy at ₹4,000/- per hectare.
benefits: Back-ended investment subsidy to paddy growers @ ₹4
000/- per hectare.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident/native of Puducherry.The applicant should be residing in the Yanam region.The applicant should be a Farmer.The applicant should possess land holdings.
required_documents: Aadhaar Card.Ration Card.Applicant's Photo.Farmer's Identity Card.Bank Passbook.FMB (Field Measurement Book).Residence-cum-Nativity Certificate
issued by the competent authority.

faqs.question: Is the subsidy applicable to all farmers in Puducherry?
faqs.answer: No, only paddy farmers residing in the Yanam region are eligible for the subsidy.

faqs.question: Name the offices from where an applicant can obtain the application form.
faqs.answer: The Agricultural Officers of the Uzhavar Udhaviyagam and the Office of the Deputy Director of Agriculture, Yanam.

faqs.question: What is the amount of the back-ended investment subsidy provided to paddy growers?
faqs.answer: Paddy growers receive a subsidy of ₹4,000/- per hectare under this scheme.

faqs.question: Who administers the "Crop Production Technology" Scheme in the Union Territory of Puducherry?
faqs.answer: The Department of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare, Union Territory of Puducherry, administers the scheme.

faqs.question: Are there provisions for additional incentives or bonuses within the subsidy scheme?
faqs.answer: There are no explicit provisions for additional incentives or bonuses within the current scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any provisions for adjusting the subsidy amount based on crop yield or quality?
faqs.answer: No, the subsidy amount remains fixed at ₹4,000/- per hectare and is not adjusted based on crop yield or quality.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy amount be disbursed in instalments, or is it a lump sum payment?
faqs.answer: The subsidy amount is provided as a back-ended investment and is typically disbursed as a lump sum payment.

faqs.question: Is there a maximum limit on the total subsidy amount a farmer can receive under this scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no specified maximum limit; however, the subsidy is calculated per hectare of land cultivated.

faqs.question: Is the subsidy amount subject to income tax, and does the farmer need to declare it?
faqs.answer: The subsidy amount is generally exempt from income tax, but farmers are advised to consult with a tax professional for specific details.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy amount be transferred directly to the bank account of the beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the subsidy amount is often transferred directly to the bank account of the eligible paddy farmer.

faqs.question: How does the government verify the authenticity of the applicant's residency in Yanam?
faqs.answer: The Residence-cum-Nativity Certificate, issued by the competent authority, serves as a crucial document for verifying residency authenticity.

faqs.question: Can a farmer with holdings in multiple regions of Puducherry avail the subsidy for each region?
faqs.answer: No, the subsidy is specific to the Yanam region, and holdings in other regions do not make the farmer eligible for this scheme.

name: Distribution of Rhizobium
description: The “Distribution of Rhizobium” scheme by the Agriculture-Farmers Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, provides a subsidy to farmers for the purchase of Rhizobium, which is essential for improving soil fertility and crop yield in Pulses farming.﻿
benefits: Quantum of Assistance: 50% on the cost of Rhizobium or ₹100/- per ha. whichever is less.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The beneficiary should be a Farmer.The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.The beneficiary should raise seed farms with Pulses crops.
required_documents: Proof of Identity (Aadhar Card
Voter ID
etc.).Proof of Land Ownership.Proof of Pulses crop cultivation.Caste Certificate (for SC/ST applicants).Bank Account Details.Any other documents (if required).

faqs.question: What is the “Distribution of Rhizobium” scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Distribution of Rhizobium' scheme is a state-sponsored subsidy initiative by the Tamil Nadu government aimed at supporting farmers who raise seed farms with Pulses crops.

faqs.question: What subsidy is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, farmers receive a subsidy of 50% on the cost of Rhizobium or ₹100/- per hectare, whichever is less.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: All farmers who raise seed farms with Pulses crops are eligible. The scheme prioritizes SC/ST farmers and Farm Women.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply for the subsidy?
faqs.answer: Applications must be submitted to the Assistant Agricultural Officer at the Village Level, Agricultural Officer/Deputy Agricultural Officer at the Block Level, or the Joint Director of Agriculture at the District Level.

faqs.question: Is there any priority given to certain groups under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, 24% of the benefits are reserved for SC/ST farmers, and 20% are reserved for Farm Women.

faqs.question: What documents are required for applying?
faqs.answer: Applicants need to provide identity proof, proof of land ownership or lease, a caste certificate (for SC/ST farmers), proof of being a Farm Woman (if applicable), and the completed application form.

faqs.question: How much subsidy is granted per hectare?
faqs.answer: The subsidy granted is ₹100/- per hectare or 50% of the Rhizobium cost, whichever is less.

faqs.question: Where should the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: Applications should be submitted to the relevant agricultural officers at the village, block, or district level.

faqs.question: Can a farmer apply if they are not an SC/ST farmer or Farm Woman?
faqs.answer: Yes, all eligible farmers can apply, although priority is given to SC/ST farmers and Farm Women.

faqs.question: What is Rhizobium, and why is it important?
faqs.answer: Rhizobium is a soil bacterium that improves soil fertility and increases the yield of Pulses crops, making it essential for sustainable agriculture.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for applying to the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no age limit specified for eligibility under this scheme.

faqs.question: Can an applicant reapply if their application is rejected?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can reapply if their application is rejected, provided they address the reasons for the rejection.

name: Financial Assistance to Purchase/Construct New Fishing Craft less than 26 feet for Fishing in Inland Waters of Goa
description: “Financial Assistance to Purchase/Construct New Fishing Craft less than 26 feet for Fishing in Inland Waters of Goa” is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. The scheme has been introduced to uplift the sizeable community of traditional Fishermen, by providing them financial help in the form of a subsidy on the construction/ purchase of Fishing Craft less than 26 feet for fishing in inland waters of Goa. The applications are accepted only in offline mode.
benefits: For General Category50% subsidy
limited to ₹30
on a unit cost of ₹60
000 (excluding GST).For SC/ST/Woman Category60% subsidy
limited to ₹36
on a unit cost of ₹60
000 (excluding GST).NOTE: The benefits can be availed after every 7 years against the replacement of the existing Canoe.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a traditional fisherman by birth or profession.The applicant should be a resident of Goa.The Fishing Canoe should be registered with the Department of Captain of Ports
Government of Goa.
required_documents: 1. Original Invoice towards Purchase/Construction of New Fibre Reinforced Plastic (FRP).2. Vessel Registration Certificate issued by Captain of Ports.3. River Gill Net Registration Certificate and License Certificate issued by the Department of Fisheries.4. Undertaking as per Proforma.5. Copy of Aadhaar (Unique Identification) Card.6. Other Backward Class (OBC) (Kharvi) Certificate or Profession Certificate issued by the Competent Authority
such as Mamlatdar or Chief Officer of the concerned Municipality
or Secretary of the concerned Village Panchayat

duly countersigned by the concerned Block Development Officer (B.D.O).7. Scheduled Tribe (ST)/Scheduled Caste (SC) Certificate (if applicable).8. Mandate Form along with Bank Pass Book.9. Bills from the Authorized Boat Dealer for the construction of the Fishing Canoe.

faqs.question: Could you provide information on the website and contact details for the Department of Fisheries?
faqs.answer: The department's website is https://fisheries.goa.gov.in/, and contact details include Tel: (O) 2224838, Tel: (Dir) 2227780, Email: dir-fish.goa@nic.in.

faqs.question: Is there a specific department contact for addressing grievances, and what is the communication timeline for grievance resolution?
faqs.answer: Grievances can be addressed to the Grievance Redressal Officer or through dir-fish.goa@nic.in, with a resolution communicated within 30 days.

faqs.question: Are there any specific certificates required for OBC (Kharvi) applicants, and who can issue them?
faqs.answer: OBC (Kharvi) Certificate or Profession Certificate issued by the Competent Authority, such as Mamlatdar or Chief Officer, is required.

faqs.question: Can the application form be submitted online, or is it strictly through offline mode?
faqs.answer: The application process is strictly offline, and forms should be submitted to the designated authorities.

faqs.question: Can applicants from SC/ST/Woman categories avail a higher subsidy, and what is the limit?
faqs.answer: Yes, they can avail a 60% subsidy, limited to ₹36,000, on a unit cost of ₹60,000 (excluding GST).

faqs.question: Is there any specific format for the application form, and what mandatory fields need to be filled?
faqs.answer: The prescribed format can be obtained by paying ₹50, and all mandatory fields should be filled as per instructions.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Department of Captain of Ports in the eligibility process?
faqs.answer: The Fishing Canoe must be registered with the Department of Captain of Ports, Government of Goa.

faqs.question: How often can beneficiaries avail the benefits, and under what condition?
faqs.answer: Benefits can be availed every 7 years against the replacement of the existing Canoe.

faqs.question: Could you elaborate on the eligibility criteria for applicants, particularly regarding their profession and residency?
faqs.answer: The applicant should be a traditional fisherman by birth or profession and a resident of Goa.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for submitting applications under the scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no specific deadline; applications are accepted continuously.

faqs.question: Can Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) apply for the scheme, and are there any special criteria for them?
faqs.answer: There are no specific criteria for PwDs, and they can apply like any other eligible applicant.

faqs.question: What are the specific benefits provided for the General Category under the scheme, and is there a subsidy limit?
faqs.answer: General Category applicants receive a 50% subsidy, limited to ₹30,000, on a unit cost of ₹60,000 (excluding GST).

name: Mushroom Kit Vitaran
description: The “Mushroom Kit Vitaran” scheme launched by the Department of Agriculture, Bihar, aims to encourage farmers and individuals to engage in mushroom cultivation by providing high-quality mushroom kits at a 90% subsidy and through training programs.﻿
benefits: Subsidized Mushroom Kits: Kits provided at ₹60/- each with a 90% subsidy.High-Quality Materials: Kits weigh 5 kg and include 100 grams of superior mushroom spawn.Training Support: 2-days group training is provided
with a daily allowance of ₹1000/- per farmer.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Bihar.The applicant should be a farmer.The applicant must be registered on the DBT portal.Farmers who have taken advantage of the scheme in the last three years (202-22

2022-23 and 2023-24) will not be given the benefit of the scheme this year.﻿Note:  The benefit of this scheme will be given only once to one member of the family.Beneficiaries will be selected on first come first serve basis.﻿﻿﻿
required_documents: For DBT Registration Process:Aadhaar Details (Should be linked with mobile number).Passport Size Photo.Farmer details.Land information.Bank account.For the Online Application of the Scheme:Passport Size Photo.

faqs.question: What is the “Mushroom Kit Vitaran” scheme?
faqs.answer: The Mushroom Kit Vitaran scheme is a government initiative aimed at promoting mushroom cultivation by providing farmers with highly subsidized mushroom kits and necessary training.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Farmers who have not benefited from the scheme in the last three years are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for applicants to own land to avail of this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, land ownership is not mandatory for availing of the benefits of this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the cost of a mushroom kit under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The unit cost of a mushroom kit is ₹60/-, and the government provides a 90% subsidy, significantly reducing the cost for farmers.

faqs.question: What is the quantity of kits an applicant can receive under the scheme?
faqs.answer: An applicant can receive a minimum of 25 kits and a maximum of 100 kits under this scheme.

faqs.question: What are the specifications of the mushroom kits provided?
faqs.answer: Each mushroom kit weighs 5 kg and contains 100 grams of high-quality mushroom spawn.

faqs.question: Where is the training for mushroom cultivation conducted?
faqs.answer: Training is conducted at locations such as the Center of Excellence, Krishi Vigyan Kendras, Agricultural Universities, and Horticulture Colleges.

faqs.question: What is the duration and support provided for the training?
faqs.answer: The training is a two-day program and a provision of ₹1,000/- per farmer per day is allocated.

faqs.question: Can more than one member of a family benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only one member per family is eligible to receive benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: What percentage of subsidy is provided on mushroom kits?
faqs.answer: The government provides a 90% subsidy on the unit cost of the mushroom kits.

faqs.question: What support does the scheme provide during the training program?
faqs.answer: The scheme allocates ₹1,000/- per farmer per day to cover expenses related to the training program, ensuring farmers receive proper guidance and resources.

name: Cluster Mei Bagwani Ki Yojana-II
description: “Cluster Mei Bagwani Ki Yojana-II” launched by the Department of Agriculture, Bihar, aims to promote cluster-based cultivation of selected crops, including guava, amla, lemon, bael, lemongrass, papaya, marigold, dragon fruit, and strawberry. The scheme offers subsidies to farmers to expand crop areas and enhance agricultural income.
benefits: Subsidy for Standard Crops: ₹1
000/- per acre for guava
amla
lemon
bael
lemongrass
papaya
and marigold Subsidy for Premium Crops: ₹2
000/- per acre for dragon fruit and strawberry.Supply of plant material.Note: Beneficiary allocation:General Category: 78.56%.Scheduled Castes: 20%.Scheduled Tribes: 1.44%.Women Participation: 30%.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be an individual farmers/ farmers group/ Farmers Producer Organization (FPO)/ cooperative society or registered institution.The applicant must have agricultural land a minimum of 0.25 acres and a maximum of 10 acres (25 acres for cluster area).The applicant must be registered on the DBT portal.
required_documents: For DBT Registration Process:Aadhaar Details (Should be linked with mobile number).Passport Size Photo.Farmer details.Land information.Bank account.For the Online Application of the Scheme:Passport Size Photo.﻿Contract form ( for non-ryot farmers).Land-ownership/ revenue receipt (If applicable).Note: If the applicant's name is not clear in the land-ownership/ revenue receipt

it will be mandatory to attach the genealogy along with the land-ownership/ revenue receipt.Land ownership certificate should be updated from the last 3 years and the revenue receipt is from last 1 year.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: "Cluster Mei Bagani Ki Yojana" is a government initiative aimed at promoting cluster-based farming of selected high-value crops by providing financial assistance to farmers.

faqs.question: Which crops are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme includes guava, amla, lemon, bael, lemongrass, papaya, marigold, dragon fruit, and strawberry as eligible crops.

faqs.question: What is the minimum and maximum area eligible for subsidy under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides subsidies for a minimum area of 0.25 acres (0.1 hectare) and a maximum of 10 acres (4 hectares) per applicant.

faqs.question: How much subsidy is provided under "Cluster Mei Bagani Ki Yojana"?
faqs.answer: Farmers are eligible for a subsidy of up to ₹1,00,000/- per acre for crops such as guava, amla, lemon, bael, lemongrass, papaya, and marigold. For dragon fruit and strawberry, the subsidy is higher, up to ₹2,00,000/- per acre.

faqs.question: How is the subsidy amount disbursed to the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is paid in two installments, with 65% of the amount provided initially and the remaining 35% given later.

faqs.question: Are non-landowners eligible to benefit from the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-landowners are eligible to apply if they submit a valid Contract Form in the prescribed format, which is available for download on the official portal.

faqs.question: How can applicants ensure that their registered bank details are correct?
faqs.answer: Applicants are advised to verify their registered bank details in the "Direct Benefit Transfer" (DBT) system before submitting their applications.

faqs.question: What is the priority for women farmers under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme reserves a minimum of 30% of the beneficiary slots for women farmers across all categories to encourage their participation.

faqs.question: How is financial assistance provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance is directly transferred to the beneficiaries' registered bank accounts through the "Direct Benefit Transfer" (DBT) program managed by CFMS.

faqs.question: Who can farmers contact for further details or support regarding the scheme?
faqs.answer: Farmers can reach out to their local agriculture department office or visit the official portal of the scheme for additional information and assistance.

name: Diesel VAT Relief Scheme for Fishermen
description: The "Diesel VAT Relief Scheme for Fishermen" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support fishermen by subsidizing the VAT on diesel, making fuel more affordable for their mechanized boats. This helps reduce the operational cost of fishermen using mechanized boats.
benefits: Name of ComponentStandard of AssistanceMinimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming BenefitsDiesel VAT assistancePer litre maximum assistance up to ₹15/-Assistance is available as per fixed diesel quota throughout the year
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a registered diesel cardholder.The applicant must own a mechanized fishing boat.The boat should be less than 20 meters in length.﻿﻿
required_documents: Valid Diesel Card issued by the government.Boat registration certificate.Identification proof (Aadhaar Card
Fishermen ID
etc.).Any other documents as required.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the "Diesel VAT Relief Scheme for Fishermen" scheme?
faqs.answer: The "Diesel VAT Relief Scheme for Fishermen" provides financial assistance by subsidizing the VAT levied on high-speed diesel used in fishing boats. This helps reduce the operational cost of fishermen using mechanized boats.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Fishermen who own mechanized fishing boats that are less than 20 meters in length and possess a valid diesel card issued by the government are eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, eligible fishermen can receive a maximum VAT subsidy of ₹15 per litre of diesel.

faqs.question: Is it necessary for fishermen to submit an application to receive the subsidy?
faqs.answer: No, fishermen do not need to apply separately, as the subsidy is automatically processed through an online system.

faqs.question: Where must eligible fishermen purchase diesel to avail of the subsidy?
faqs.answer: Fishermen must purchase diesel from government-approved diesel pumps to be eligible for the VAT subsidy.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the amount of diesel a fisherman can purchase under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the government sets a fixed diesel quota per fisherman, which determines the amount of diesel that can be purchased at the subsidized rate.

faqs.question: Are fishermen owning boats longer than 20 meters eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only those who own mechanized fishing boats under 20 meters in length are eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: What documents are required to avail of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Fishermen need a valid diesel card, a boat registration certificate, and identification proof such as an Aadhaar Card or Fishermen ID. Additional documents may required as per the authority along with the above-mentioned documents.

name: Aaloo Ke Kufri Chipsona-1 Prabhed Ke Kshetra Vistaar Yojana
description: “Aaloo Ke Kufri Chipsona-1 Prabed Ke Kshetra Vistaar Yojana” launched by the Department of Agriculture, Bihar, aims to increase the production of Kufri Chipsona variety suitable for potato processing in Bihar by expanding its area and to increase the income of farmers by promoting processing. Under this scheme, certified quality seeds of Kufri Chipsona variety suitable for potato processing will be made available to farmers.﻿
benefits: Affordable High-Quality Seeds: Farmers will receive Kufri Chipsona-I potato seeds at an estimated price of ₹4
000/- per quintal or the actual seed price
whichever is lower.Financial Assistance: Total ₹93
863/- per hectare (First year: ₹70
397/- and Second year: ₹23
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Bihar.The applicant should be a farmer.The applicant must have agricultural land a minimum of 0.25 acres (0.1 ha) and a maximum of 5 acres (2 ha).The applicant must be registered on the DBT portal.﻿Note 1:  Beneficiary allocation:General Category: 78.56%.Scheduled Castes: 20%.Scheduled Tribes: 1.44%.Women Participation: 30%.Note 2: The benefits of this scheme can be taken by ryot farmers on the basis of land documents and non-ryot farmers on the basis of contract form.Note 3: Beneficiaries will be selected on first come first serve basis.
required_documents: For DBT Registration Process:Aadhaar Details (Should be linked with mobile number).Passport Size Photo.Farmer details.Land information.Bank account.For the Online Application of the Scheme:Passport Size Photo.﻿Contract form ( for non-ryot farmers).Land-ownership/ revenue receipt (If applicable).Note: If the applicant's name is not clear in the land-ownership/ revenue receipt
it will be mandatory to attach the genealogy along with the land-ownership/ revenue receipt.

faqs.question: What is the primary goal of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to promote the production of the Kufri Chipsona-I potato variety suitable for processing, thereby increasing farmers’ incomes and supporting the potato processing industry in Bihar.

faqs.question: What benefits do farmers receive under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Farmers receive high-quality Kufri Chipsona-I potato seeds at a subsidized cost and financial assistance totaling ₹93,863/- per hectare over two years.

faqs.question: What is the cost of the potato seeds provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The seeds are provided at an estimated cost of ₹4,000/- per quintal or the actual market price, whichever is lower.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is offered to farmers under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Farmers are provided ₹70,397/- per hectare in the first year and ₹23,466/- per hectare in the second year, totaling ₹93,863 per hectare.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is open to farmers residing in Bihar who own or lease agricultural land measuring between 0.25 acres and 5 acres and are registered on the DBT portal.

faqs.question: Can non-landholding farmers apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-landholding farmers (non-ryot) can apply based on contract farming agreements.

faqs.question: How are beneficiaries selected under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries are selected on a first-come, first-served basis, subject to the availability of funds and resources.

faqs.question: Is there any reservation or category-based allocation in the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme allocates benefits as follows: General Category (78.56%), Scheduled Castes (20%), Scheduled Tribes (1.44%), and Women (30%).

faqs.question: What happens if the applicant's name is unclear in land documents?
faqs.answer: If the name is unclear in land-ownership or revenue receipts, the applicant must attach a genealogy document along with the land-related papers.

faqs.question: Do farmers need to register for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, farmers must register on the DBT portal to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: What type of seeds are provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides certified, high-quality Kufri Chipsona-I seeds suitable for potato processing.

faqs.question: Can women farmers apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, 30% of the scheme's benefits are reserved for women farmers.

name: Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities by Establishing Piggery, Sheep and Goat Units (General) under Mukhya Mantri Antyodaya Parivaar Utthan Yojana
description: The scheme “Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities by Establishing Piggery, Sheep and Goat Units (General) under Mukhya Mantri Antyodaya Parivaar Utthan Yojana” is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, an unemployed resident of Haryana who is between 18 and 60 years of age can avail a 25% subsidy on the cost of livestock, provided they have taken a loan for establishing a 10+1 Piggery unit or a 15+1 Sheep/Goat unit.
benefits: Financial Assistance under the Scheme:Establishment of 10+1 Piggery units: 25% subsidy on the cost of livestock which has been availed as a loan by the beneficiary for establishment of a 10+1 Piggery unit. A maximum amount of ₹25

000/- will be provided as financial assistance in form of a subsidy.Establishment of 15+1 Sheep/Goat units:25% subsidy on the cost of livestock which has been availed as a loan by the beneficiary for establishment of 15+1 Sheep/Goat unit. A maximum amount of ₹24

500/- will be provided as financial assistance in form of a subsidy.Financial Assistance for Insurance under the Scheme:Insurance assistance will be provided as per the available departmental scheme if operational during the year; otherwise
the beneficiaries will have to arrange for insurance of animals and shall pay the insurance premium.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be 18 to 60 years of age and a resident of Haryana.The applicant must be unemployed.There would be no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements.The applicant should have a space/shed for keeping animals.The applicant would have to submit a Self-Declaration for being unemployed and for undertaking to abide by other conditions as required under the Scheme.
required_documents: 1.	Privaar Pahchan Patra (PPP ID)2.	Copy of Aadhaar Card3.	Copy of PAN Card4.	Copy of Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque5.	Proof of availability of shed/space for keeping animals6.	Any other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide employment opportunities to unemployed residents of Haryana by helping them establish piggery, sheep, and goat units.

faqs.question: What are the age criteria for eligibility under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be between 18 and 60 years of age.

faqs.question: Can individuals from other states apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only residents of Haryana are eligible.

faqs.question: Is there a subsidy provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, a 25% subsidy on the cost of livestock is provided, with specific financial limits.

faqs.question: How much subsidy can one get for establishing a 10+1 piggery unit?
faqs.answer: A maximum of ₹25,000 as financial assistance in the form of subsidy.

faqs.question: How much subsidy is available for establishing a 15+1 sheep/goat unit?
faqs.answer: A maximum of ₹24,500 as financial assistance in the form of subsidy.

faqs.question: Is insurance assistance provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, insurance assistance is provided as per the available departmental scheme. If not operational, beneficiaries need to arrange and pay for insurance premiums themselves.

faqs.question: Are there any educational qualifications required for applying to this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements.

faqs.question: Can groups or organizations apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only for individual beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Do applicants need to have a specific space for keeping the animals?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must have space or a shed for keeping the animals.

faqs.question: How can one apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail the benefits of the scheme, applicants should visit the Deputy Director's office in their district and collect the application form.

name: Anti Bird Net
description: The Anti-Bird Net Scheme, an initiative by the Agriculture Department of the Rajasthan government, promotes protected cultivation practices among farmers by providing subsidies for installing low-cost plastic tunnels. The subsidy amount may be capped for each farmer, depending on the scheme's provisions and available funds.Important pointsThe work can be started only after the administrative approval/work order is issued by the Horticulture Department.After establishment, verification can be done by the committee formed.The grant amount can be paid directly into the farmer's bank account or to the producing firm based on the written consent of the farmer.﻿
benefits: 50 percent subsidy is payable for a maximum area of 5000 square meters.

his own fruit orchard
and an irrigation source.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To protect horticultural crops from damage caused by birds.

faqs.question: May Other State persons also apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is only for Rajasthan.

faqs.question: Who Can Get The Benefits Of The Scheme ?
faqs.answer: Farmers get benefits from the scheme.

faqs.question: How much subsidy give in this scheme?
faqs.answer: 50 percent subsidy is payable for a maximum area of 5000 square meters.

faqs.question: Is there any Requirement ownership of cultivable land?
faqs.answer: Yes, The applicant must have ownership of cultivable land.

faqs.question: What is Janadhar card?
faqs.answer: Jan Aadhaar is "one number, one card, one identity" scheme, Its main objective is to prepare a. database of demographic and socio-economic information of the resident families of the state and through the Jan Aadhaar card, the identity of the family and its members.

faqs.question: How do a applicant know if a field in the application form is mandatory?
faqs.answer: A distinctive sign (“*” symbol, “mandatory” mention, etc.)

faqs.question: How can i apply online?
faqs.answer:
One can apply by visiting the e-Mitra centre.
https://sso.rajasthan.gov.in/signin

faqs.question: What documents are required ?
faqs.answer: Aadhar Card / Jan Aadhar Card, copy of Jamabandi (not older than six months), quotation from an approved firm.

faqs.question: Is there any educational qualification required for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no educational qualification required.

name: Fish Extension, Research, and Training Scheme
description: The "Fish Extension, Research, and Training Scheme" by the Department of Fisheries, Government of India aims to promote sustainable fishing practices and enhance fish production through scientific research, extension, and skill development. Under this scheme, financial and technical assistance are provided to fish farmers, fishery extension workers, and others in the fisheries sector.
benefits: Training and Workshops:Fish Seed Producers: 3-day training with a subsidy of ₹225.50 per participant (excluding travel/accommodation).Fish Farmers/Stakeholders: Workshops with a subsidy of ₹1500.50 per participant (covering expenses and travel up to ₹600).Fish Production and Research:₹2

000/- for producing 5 tons of Pangasius fish.Support for research on new fish species and maintenance of labs/museums.Fish Seed Distribution:Subsidies for seed procurement of various fish species (e.g.
Amur Carp
Tilapia).Incentives:Up to ₹30
000 for exemplary farmers
with awards in the form of equipment (e.g.
aerators
oxygen cylinders).Identity Cards:Issuance of identity cards for 1
050 fishermen.Public Awareness:₹100 per day for Birsa Fish Farmers during workshops.Cage Fish Culture Support:Financial assistance for information collection and technical support.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a registered fish farmer

or related entity in the fisheries sector.The applicant should have prior experience or relevant qualifications in the fisheries field.The applicant should be from a region identified under the scheme by the Department of Fisheries.Preference will be given to applicants from rural and underdeveloped areas.The applicant should have a valid bank account for fund disbursement.

faqs.question: Can fish farmers from rural areas apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, preference is given to applicants from rural and underdeveloped areas, making it easier for rural fish farmers to apply.

faqs.question: What kind of financial support is available under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial support for training, infrastructure development, research projects, and technical consultations, disbursed either as grants or reimbursements.

faqs.question: How do I know if I am eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be involved in the fisheries sector (fish farmers, fishery extension workers) with prior experience or qualifications in the field.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the training programs?
faqs.answer: Apply by registering on the official NFDB website and submitting an application with required documents like qualification certificates and project proposals.

faqs.question: What documents do I need to provide when applying for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Required documents include identity proof, bank account details, fish farming registration, qualification certificates, and project proposals, if applicable.

faqs.question: How are the funds disbursed to the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Funds are disbursed through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the applicant's bank account upon approval of the project or training.

faqs.question: Can I apply for the research grant under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, research institutions and universities can apply for research grants related to sustainable fish farming practices under this scheme.

faqs.question: Can I apply for multiple types of assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can apply for more than one type of assistance, such as both training and infrastructure grants, if eligible.

faqs.question: Is there any support available for the maintenance of infrastructure developed under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme primarily offers financial assistance for infrastructure development, but ongoing maintenance is the responsibility of the applicant.

faqs.question: Are there any special provisions for women or marginalized groups under this scheme?
faqs.answer: While the scheme does not mention specific provisions for women or marginalized groups, preference is given to rural areas, which may include these communities.

faqs.question: Where can I find more information or resolve issues regarding my application?
faqs.answer: For more details or any grievances, you can visit the official NFDB website or contact the District Fisheries Office.

name: Financial Assistance to Purchase Outboard Motor of 2HP to 5 HP for Fitting to the Fishing Canoe

faqs.question: What is the Department of Fisheries' website, and where can the guidelines be found?

faqs.question: What is the Grievance Redressal process for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Any dissatisfaction or complaint can be registered with the Grievance Redressal Officer or emailed to dir-fish.goa@nic.in. The response will be communicated within 30 days.

faqs.question: What is the unit cost of the Outboard Motor for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The unit cost of the Outboard Motor is ₹60,000 (excluding GST).

faqs.question: Can a beneficiary apply online for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applications are accepted only in offline mode.

faqs.question: Where should the filled application form be submitted?
faqs.answer: The filled form and documents should be submitted to the Department of Fisheries, Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Patto Colony, Panaji Goa - 403 521, or at the BDO Office/ Sub-Offices of the Department.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant should be a traditional fisherman, a resident of Goa, and have a registered Fishing Canoe with the Department of Captain of Ports, Government of Goa.

faqs.question: What is the subsidy amount for SC/ST/Woman Category?
faqs.answer: The subsidy for SC/ST/Woman Category is 60%, limited to ₹36,000 on a unit cost of ₹60,000 (excluding GST).

faqs.question: Is there a specific format for the application form?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should request the prescribed format from the department by paying ₹50.

faqs.question: What is the Grievance Redressal Officer's contact information?
faqs.answer: The contact details are Tel: (O) 2224838 Tel: (Dir) 2227780; Fax: (0832)2231049, Email: dir-fish.goa@nic.in.

faqs.question: Are there any specific conditions for the fishing canoe under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the fishing canoe should be below 26 feet in length.

faqs.question: What is the process for obtaining the Vessel Registration Certificate (VRC)?
faqs.answer: The VRC can be obtained from the Captain of Ports or the Directorate of Fisheries, Government of Goa.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy amount exceed the unit cost of the Outboard Motor?
faqs.answer: No, the subsidy is limited to 50% of the unit cost for the General Category and 60% for SC/ST/Woman Category.

faqs.question: Is the Aadhaar Card mandatory for all applicants?
faqs.answer: Yes, a copy of the Aadhaar Card is required for the application.

faqs.question: Can a non-resident of Goa apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must be residents of Goa to be eligible.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for extending the 5-year application interval?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme allows application every 5 years with no provision for extension.

faqs.question: Is there a specific authority for verifying the Professional Certificate in the documents?
faqs.answer: The Department of Fisheries verifies the Caste Certificate/Professional Certificate during the application process.

name: Distribution of Certified Seeds-Oil Seeds
description: The "Distribution of Certified Seeds-Oil Seeds" scheme by the Agriculture-Farmers Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, provides financial assistance to farmers by subsidizing the cost of certified oil seeds. This scheme also encourages the farmers to use high-quality seeds and improve agricultural productivity.﻿﻿
benefits: Financial Assistance: Subsidy of 50% of the seed cost or ₹1
200/- per quintal
whichever is less.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The beneficiary should be a Farmer.The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.The beneficiary should produce and supply Foundation and Certified Class seeds to the Department.﻿
required_documents: Proof of identity (e.g.
Aadhaar card
Voter ID).Proof of land ownership or cultivation.Seed purchase receipt.Certificate of seed production and supply to the Department.Bank account details.Any other documents (if required).

faqs.question: What is the "Distribution of Certified Seeds-Oil Seeds" scheme?
faqs.answer: The "Distribution of Certified Seeds-Oil Seeds" scheme offers subsidies to farmers for purchasing certified oil seeds, helping them improve their crop yield and quality.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the "Distribution of Certified Seeds - Oil Seeds" scheme?
faqs.answer: Farmers who produce and supply Foundation and Certified Class seeds to the Department are eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: What subsidy amount is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a subsidy covering 50% of the seed cost or ₹1,200/- per quintal, whichever is less.

faqs.question: How can a farmer apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: A farmer can apply by submitting an application to the relevant agricultural officer at the village, block, or district level.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The required documents include proof of identity, proof of land ownership or a lease agreement, proof of seed supply to the Department, and a recent passport-sized photograph.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit for eligibility under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit specified for eligibility.

faqs.question: Are there any age restrictions for farmers applying to this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no age restrictions for eligibility under this scheme.

faqs.question: Is proof of seed supply to the Department required to avail the subsidy?
faqs.answer: Yes, farmers need to provide proof of seed supply to the Department to avail the subsidy.

faqs.question: Where should the application for this scheme be submitted?
faqs.answer: Applications should be submitted to the Assistant Agricultural Officer at the village level, the Agricultural Officer or Deputy Agricultural Officer at the block level, or the Joint Director of Agriculture at the district level.

faqs.question: Which crops are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme specifically covers oil seeds.

faqs.question: How long will the subsidy be available under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is available as per the scheme's guidelines, with no specific end date mentioned.

faqs.question: Can farmers from other states apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only farmers residing in the state are eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the primary objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective of the scheme is to promote the use of certified seeds to improve crop yield and quality among farmers.

faqs.question: What should a farmer do if their application is rejected?
faqs.answer: Farmers can inquire about the reason for rejection at the respective agricultural office and reapply if necessary.

name: Use of Advanced Drone Technology (Agriculture Aircraft) in Agriculture Sector
description: The "Use of Advanced Drone Technology (Agriculture Aircraft) in Agriculture Sector" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to promote the use of advanced drone technology for spraying crop protection chemicals, nano urea, FCO-approved liquid fertilizers, and bio-fertilizers. This technology increases efficiency, saves time and water, and reduces environmental pollution. Drones can spray 1 hectare in 20 minutes using 25 liters of water, ensuring 90% chemical efficiency and reducing pollution. The scheme offers 90% financial assistance (up to ₹500/- per acre per spraying), with a limit of 5 acres per account.﻿﻿
benefits: ﻿Name of Scheme and Standard of assistanceFinancial Provision(Rs. In lakh)Implementing Agency/officeUse of advanced Drone technology (agriculture aircraft) in agriculture sector 1) 90% of the cost or a maximum of Rs. 500/- whichever is less will be admissible per acre/per spraying₹500.00/-IFFCO or Subsidiary Organisation/Co-operative Organisation/Farmers Producer Organization (FPO)/Farmer Producing Company (FPC) designated by IFFCOAssistance will be admissible to a maximum of five acres per spraying per account.₹500.00/-Directorate of Agriculture (through i-Khedut Portal)﻿
eligibility_criteria: The beneficiary should be land holder.The beneficiary farmer should have minimum 1 acre Agricultural land.The beneficiary farmer must have his own bank account (Bank passbook and cancelled check).The beneficiary must have Aadhar card as identity proof.The beneficiary must have a Certified bill of purchase of equipment/items.
required_documents: Aadhar Card (Mandatory).Land Ownership Documents (minimum 1 acre) (Mandatory).Bank Passbook and Cancelled Cheque (for financial transactions) (Mandatory).Certified Purchase Bill of Equipment/Items (Mandatory).Signed Online Application Form (from i-Khedut Portal) (Mandatory).Any other document if required.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the "Use of Advanced Drone Technology (Agriculture Aircraft) in Agriculture Sector" scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the "the "Use of Advanced Drone Technology (Agriculture Aircraft) in Agriculture Sector" scheme is to promote modern agricultural practices by using advanced drone technology for spraying crop protection chemicals, nano urea, FCO-approved liquid fertilizers, and bio-fertilizers.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Any landholding farmer in Gujarat with at least 1 acre of agricultural land is eligible to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the financial assistance provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides 90% of the cost or a maximum of ₹500/- per acre per spraying, with a limit of five acres per spraying per account.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of using drone technology for spraying?
faqs.answer: Drone spraying saves time and water, ensures 90% effective chemical use, reduces pollution, and addresses labor shortages in agriculture.

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the number of acres a farmer can get assistance for?
faqs.answer: Yes, financial assistance is provided for up to 5 acres per spraying per account.

faqs.question: Do farmers need to purchase their own drones to avail of the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, farmers can use drone spraying services provided by IFFCO, cooperative organizations, or Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs).

faqs.question: How is the subsidy amount disbursed to the farmers?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is credited directly to the farmer’s bank account after approval and verification.

faqs.question: How the assistance is provided to the farmer?
faqs.answer: The District Agriculture Officer shall pay the assistance amount into the bank account of the applicant farmer beneficiary through ECS (Electronic Clearance Service)/RTGS (Real Time Gross Settlement)/Account Pay Cheque/NEFT/PFMS

faqs.question: What is the process to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Farmers can apply online through the i-Khedut portal (https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/), print and sign the application, and keep it for further processing.

name: YSR Jala Kala
description: The scheme "YSR Jala Kala" is one of the 'NAVARATNALU' schemes by the Department of Rural Development, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh. In this program, bore wells are drilled free of cost to the needy and eligible farmers in all thirteen districts of the state. NAVARATNALU is a concept coined to improve the delivery systems and improve the living standards of the people, and the quality of the governance in the state. Of the welfare schemes under NAVARATNALU, “YSR Jala Kala" is aimed at utilizing the available groundwater resources for the improvement of the livelihoods of the farmers and thereby improving the GSDP under the primary sector. This shall help in optimally utilizing groundwater resources for the purpose of irrigating every acre of arable land. These bore wells shall be drilled after conducting integrated Hydrogeological and Geophysical surveys in the field for identifying feasible sites before taking up the drilling activity.
benefits: Drilling of the Borewells: A drilled borewell with a minimum yield of 1000 GPH (4500 liters per hour) by 900 ‘V’ notch method.In case
the bore well fails
the drilling contractor shall drill the second bore well in the land of the same farmer
if feasible

and refill the failed bore well with soil and stone pieces before shifting the rig or utilizing that as a recharge well.Construction of Recharge Pit / Water Harvesting Structure.A social Audit will be conducted for all the borewells drilled.The digital photograph with geo-tag (date
time
latitude
and longitude) shall be taken by the concerned authorities deputed along with the beneficiary in the presence of the drilling contractor after completion of borewell drilling
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a Farmer.The applicant should be a resident of the state of Andhra Pradesh.The applicant should be without an existing bore well/tube well OR having a failed bore well/tube well.
required_documents: Aadhar cardWhite Ration CardApplication formFirst and Second Page of the Land PassbookResidential proofPassport size photographMobile numberCaste certificate

faqs.question: Which Department Introduced The "YSR Jala Kala" Scheme?
faqs.answer: The "YSR Jala Kala" scheme was introduced by the Department of Rural Development, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of The "YSR Jala Kala" Scheme?
faqs.answer: "YSR Jala Kala" is aimed at utilizing the available groundwater resources for the improvement of the livelihoods of the farmers and thereby improving the GSDP under the primary sector.  This shall help in optimally utilizing groundwater resources for the purpose of irrigating every acre of arable land.

faqs.question: Are The Borewells Construced Directly Or Is There Any Preliminary Survey Involved?
faqs.answer: The bore wells shall be drilled after conducting integrated Hydrogeological and Geophysical surveys in the field for identifying feasible sites before taking up the drilling activity.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Specifications Of The Borewells To Be Constructed Through This Scheme?
faqs.answer: A drilled borewell with a minimum yield of 1000 GPH (4500 liters per hour) by 90 0 ‘V’ notch method shall be considered as successful borewell.

faqs.question: What Would Happen In Case The Borewell Fails?
faqs.answer: In case, the bore well fails, the drilling contractor shall drill second bore well in the land of same farmer, if feasible, and refill the failed bore well with soil and stone pieces before shifting the rig or utilize that as a recharge well, if feasible, and this shall be monitored and ensured by the concerned APD, DWMA / MPDO.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Link To The Scheme Guidelines?
faqs.answer:
The link to the guidelines of "YSR Jala Kala" scheme can be found at:
http://ysrjalakala.ap.gov.in/YSRRB/UserInterface/Application/Rdlc/Templates/09102020PR_MS676.pdf

faqs.question: What Is Meant By "NAVARATNALU"?
faqs.answer: NAVARATNALU is a concept coined by the Government to improve the delivery systems and improve the quality of the Governance in the State. It is designed to improve the living standards of the people. Of the welfare schemes proposed by the State Government under NAVARATNALU, “YSR Jala Kala – Free Bore wells” programme is aimed at utilizing the available groundwater resources for the improvement of livelihoods of the farmers and thereby improve the GSDP under primary sector.

faqs.question: Is The "YSR Jala Kala" Only Applicable To A Selected Districts Of Andhra Pradesh?
faqs.answer: The scope of the "YSR Jala Kala" scheme extends to all the thirteen (13) districts of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: Can A Farmer Who Already Has An Existing Borewell Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only the farmer without an existing bore well/tube well OR having a failed bore well/tube well is eligible.

faqs.question: Does The Scope Of The "YSR Jala Kala" Scheme Extends To The Over Exploited Revenue Villages?
faqs.answer: There are 1094 over-exploited revenue villages notified as per G.O.MS.No.548 dated 27-02-2020 of the PR&RD department. Lands falling in these villages are not eligible under the scheme, Government notifies the list of over exploited revenue villages from time to time.

faqs.question: Who Shall Be Assigned The Task Of Locating The Feasible Sites For Drilling Of Borewells?
faqs.answer: The drilling contractor shall engage Geologist/Geophysicist from the Ground Water and Water Audit department/any qualified Geologist/Geophysicist registered with the Ground Water and Water Audit Department for locating the feasible sites in the lands of beneficiaries for drilling bore wells successfully.

faqs.question: What Is The Full-Form Of APWALTA?
faqs.answer: The full-form of APWALTA is Andhra Pradesh Water, Land and Trees Act, 2002.

faqs.question: To Whom Shall The Details Of Feasible Sites Be Submitted?
faqs.answer:
The details of the feasible sites identified along with respective integrated hydro geological and geophysical survey reports shall be 
submitted to APD, DWMA / MPDO by the drilling contractor.

name: Scheme for Conservation and Development of Indigenous Cattle and Murrah Development
description: The scheme “Scheme for Conservation and Development of Indigenous Cattle and Murrah Development” is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana with the objective of encouraging the farmers for conservation and development of the Indigenous breeds of cows and buffaloes. Long-term objectives: Conservation and up-gradation of valuable indigenous germplasm available in the State of Haryana.Increase in milk production and overall productivity.Medium-term objectives (5 years Horizon):Identification of top-quality germplasm of indigenous breeds of Cow and buffalo and their insemination with high-quality semen for sustainable genetic improvement.Encouraging the farmers to rear and breed high-yielding animals of genetic merit.Description of Scheme:Murrah buffaloes meeting the benchmark of 18 kg daily peak yield would be properly identified (with ear tags) along with their progeny. Cash incentives ranging from ₹15,000/- to ₹30,000/- would be provided to owners of these buffaloes.Haryana, Sahiwal and Belahi cows, meeting the benchmark of 8 kg, 10 kg, and 5 Kg peak yield respectively would be properly identified (with ear tags) along with their progeny. The cash incentives ranging from ₹5,000/- to ₹20,000/- would be provided to owners of these cows.The beneficiaries will be under obligation not to sell the buffalo/cow and its progeny for at least one year as the main objective of scheme is to conserve the indigenous breeds of Cow and buffalo.The identified animals would be insured and part of insurance premium will be borne under the prevailing insurance scheme if any, and rest will be paid by the beneficiary as per insurance scheme.If no Livestock Insurance Scheme is in operation then the beneficiary would have to arrange for the insurance of the animals on its own and the insurance premium shall be paid by the beneficiary.
benefits: 1. Cash incentives at the following rates in different slabs would be provided to the owners of the recorded Murrah Buffaloes as below:Sl. No.Slabs of Lactation yield in Kg  (Peak Yield in Kg)Incentive Money (₹)118 to 22 Kg₹15

000/-2. Cash incentives at the following rates in different slabs would be provided to the owners of the recorded Cows of different Indigenous breeds as below: (Hariana Cows)Sl. No.Slabs of peak Yield in KgIncentive Money (₹)18 to 10 Kg₹10
000/-3.  Sahiwal CowsSl. No.Slabs of peak Yield in KgIncentive Money (₹)110 to 12 Kg₹10
000/-4.  Belahi CowsSl. No.Slabs of peak Yield in KgIncentive Money (₹)15 to 8 Kg₹5
000/-In lieu of the cash incentive provided

the owner would be under obligation not to sell the recorded Indigenous Cow/Murrah Buffalo and its male progeny at least for one year. The beneficiary would be further bound to look after the male calf properly and the Department will have the first right to purchase it. In case
the beneficiary does not abide by the contract i.e. disposes of the identified Indigenous Cow/Murrah Buffalo and/or its male calf
he would not be eligible for the cash incentive. The owners of the recorded cows/buffaloes would be required to breed their animals through artificial insemination by the Government.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Haryana.The applicant must be of the age of 18 - 55 years.A Cow or Buffalo eligible to be recorded must be between 05 to 75 days of the date of its Calving as on date of application.A maximum of two milch animals (two Cows or Two Buffaloes or One Cow and One Buffalo) per applicant/beneficiary would be eligible for the incentive money under this scheme.The cows must be true to Hariana
Sahiwal

or Belahi breed and buffalo must be of Murrah Breed only.Incentive for a particular animal could be provided only twice in its life span i.e. if the incentive is provided to a beneficiary for a particular animal twice

such beneficiary would stand debarred for receiving an incentive for that animal in its subsequent calving in the future.The scheme is individual beneficiary-oriented.Note 01: A maximum of two milch animals per applicant will be eligible for the incentive money under this scheme. However
the recordings of more than two buffaloes/Cows of an applicant may be carried out for collecting data of the top quality Murrah buffaloes/Indigenous cattle (Hariana
Sahiwal

and Belahi). But incentive money would be provided only for two animals (in the highest slabs) of that applicant in a particular year.Note 02: In case an applicant lives at a place other than where the animals are kept or intended to be kept
than the jurisdiction area will be the place where animals are kept (Within state of Haryana only).
required_documents: 1.	Privaar Pahchan Patra (PPP ID)2.	Copy of Aadhaar Card3.	Copy of PAN Card4.	Copy of Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque5.	Tag No. of Animal6.	Any other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective is to encourage farmers in Haryana to conserve and develop indigenous breeds of cows and buffaloes.

faqs.question: Who implements the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: What are the long-term goals of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The long-term goals include the conservation and upgrading of valuable indigenous germplasm and increasing milk production and overall productivity.

faqs.question: What are the medium-term goals of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The medium-term goals (within five years) include identifying top-quality germplasm of indigenous breeds and encouraging farmers to rear high-yielding animals of genetic merit.

faqs.question: How are the Murrah buffaloes identified under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Murrah buffaloes meeting a daily peak yield benchmark of 18 kg are identified with ear tags, along with their progeny.

faqs.question: What incentives are provided for Murrah buffalo owners?
faqs.answer: Cash incentives ranging from ₹15,000 to ₹30,000 are provided to owners of identified Murrah buffaloes.

faqs.question: How are Hariana, Sahiwal, and Belahi cows identified under the scheme?
faqs.answer: These cows meeting benchmarks of 8 kg (Hariana), 10 kg (Sahiwal), and 5 kg (Belahi) daily peak yield are identified with ear tags, along with their progeny.

faqs.question: What is the obligation of the beneficiaries under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries are obliged not to sell the identified animals and their progeny for at least one year.

faqs.question: Are the identified animals insured under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, identified animals are insured, and part of the insurance premium is borne under the prevailing insurance scheme, with the rest paid by the beneficiary.

faqs.question: What breeds of cows are eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only Hariana, Sahiwal, and Belahi breeds are eligible.

faqs.question: What breed of buffalo is eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only the Murrah breed is eligible.

faqs.question: What is the age eligibility for applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be between 18 and 55 years old.

faqs.question: How many animals can an applicant register under the scheme?
faqs.answer: A maximum of two milch animals (two cows, two buffaloes, or one cow and one buffalo) per applicant are eligible for incentives.

faqs.question: How many times can an incentive be provided for a particular animal?
faqs.answer: Incentives can be provided only twice in an animal's lifespan.

faqs.question: Can organizations apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is for individual beneficiaries only.

faqs.question: How can one apply online for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applications can be submitted online via the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal. https://saralharyana.gov.in/

faqs.question: Where can applications be submitted?
faqs.answer: Applications can be submitted on the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal or through Common Service Centres, Antodaya Kendra, Atal Sewa Kendra, and e-disha Centres.

faqs.question: What is the jurisdiction for applicants living in a different place than where the animals are kept?
faqs.answer: The jurisdiction area is the place where the animals are kept within Haryana.

faqs.question: What are the residency requirements for applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be residents of Haryana.

name: MMKY-Financial Assistance for New Boat, Engine, and Net
description: The State plan scheme “MMKY-Financial Assistance for New Boat, Engine, and Net” was launched by the Fisheries & Animal Resources Development Department, Government of Odisha under Mukhyamantri Maschyajibi Kalyan Yojana (MMKY) in order to increase the marine fish production and to enhance incomes and livelihoods of the marine fishers.Objectives:To support the Coastal communities by provision of new wooden/FRP Boat, Engine and purchase of new fishing net.To increase the marine fish production in the state.To increase the income and to improve the welfare of coastal communities in the State.Area of Operation:The scheme shall be implemented by the Additional Fisheries Officers (Marine)/District Fisheries Officer (B&T), Balugaon for marine fishing in the coastal districts of Odisha. The district-wise annual target shall be communicated by the Director of Fisheries. The target is interchangeable depending on the progress made by the District Level Officers.
benefits: Unit Cost and Subsidy Assistance:Sl. No.ItemMaximum Unit Cost (₹ in Lakh)Maximum Government Assistance (₹ in Lakh)/BeneficiaryMaximum Government Assistance (₹ in Lakh)/Beneficiary﻿﻿﻿General (40%)Women/SC/ST/PWD/Transgender (60%)1Fishing Boat7.503.004.502Engine1.400.560.843Life Saving Equipment0.100.040.064Fishing Net1.000.400.60﻿Total10.004.006.00*NB: Items at Sl. No. 1 & 3 are mandatory and others are optional as per the requirement of the fisherman.Note 01: Financial Assistance shall be limited to 1(one) unit (boat with engine and net) per individual beneficiary.Note 02: Procurement of Fishing Boats is mandatory under this scheme. However
the procurement of Engine and Fishing Net is optional

based on the requirement of the beneficiary.Note 03: Back-ended subsidy will be limited to 60% for SC/ ST/ Women/ PWD/ Transgender and 40% for General category. Subsidy shall be released directly to the Aadhaar linked Bank Account of the beneficiary.Note 04: For a differently-abled person
the certificate of disability issued by a certifying authority/ competent authority indicating 40% or more disability as per the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act
2016 will be accepted for the PWD category) /Transgender. (The certificate of identity as transgender person issued by the District Magistrate as per "the transgender person protection of Rights Act
2019 will be accepted for the transgender category.Note 05: In case
Government in the F & ARD Department enhances the percentage of subsidy that shall be applicable for those beneficiaries who have received go -ahead letter during the FY 2023-24.
eligibility_criteria: The following are the eligibility criteria of the beneficiary:The beneficiary should be a resident of Odisha and must possess identity and residential proof including an Aadhaar Card.The beneficiary should have a Bank Account in his/her name in the State of Odisha.The beneficiary should have QR Coded Aadhaar Card.The beneficiary should not have received any financial assistance from Government /any Agency towards the purchase of any new boat/engine in the last 5 Years (the beneficiary should not have availed subsidy after 1st April 2018) and net in the last 3 Years (the beneficiary should not have availed subsidy after 1st April 2020).While availing subsidy

the beneficiary family will be considered instead of individual members of the family. One beneficiary family should not be provided with multiple benefits under one particular scheme. A family will not be eligible for subsidy under the same scheme if any of its members have received a subsidy during the last three years.
required_documents: 1.	A copy of the Photo ID Card 2.	Passport size photograph3.	A copy of the Caste/category certificate
if applicable4.	A copy of the QR Aadhaar card5.	Bank account details/first-page bank passbook6.	Any other relevant documents
as required

faqs.question: What is 'MMKY-Financial Assistance for New Boat, Engine, and Net' Scheme?
faqs.answer: The MMKY-Financial Assistance for New Boat, Engine, and Net Scheme is a part of the Mukhyamantri Maschyajibi Kalyan Yojana (MMKY) initiated by the Fisheries & Animal Resources Development Department, Government of Odisha. The scheme aims to increase the marine fish production and to enhance the incomes and livelihoods of the marine fishers.

faqs.question: What are the key objectives of the scheme?
faqs.answer:
The primary objectives of the scheme include:
•	To support the Coastal communities by provision of new wooden/FRP Boat, Engine and purchase of new fishing net.
•	To increase the marine fish production in the state.
•	To increase the income and to improve the welfare of coastal communities in the State.

faqs.question: Who implements the Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme shall be implemented by the Additional Fisheries Officers (Marine)/District Fisheries Officer (B&T), Balugaon for marine fishing in the coastal districts of Odisha.

faqs.question: What is the area of operation for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Scheme operates in the coastal districts of Odisha.

faqs.question: Can an individual receive financial assistance for more than one unit under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, financial assistance is limited to one unit, which includes a boat with engine and net, per individual beneficiary.

faqs.question: Is the procurement of a fishing boat mandatory under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the procurement of a fishing boat is mandatory under the MMKY-Financial Assistance Scheme.

faqs.question: What is the subsidy percentage under the scheme, and does it vary for different categories?
faqs.answer: The back-ended subsidy is limited to 60% for SC/ST/Women/PWD/Transgender beneficiaries and 40% for the General category.

faqs.question: How will the subsidy amount be disbursed to the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The subsidy amount will be released directly to the Aadhaar linked Bank Account of the beneficiary.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from the Scheme?
faqs.answer:
To be eligible for the scheme, the beneficiary must meet the following criteria:
1. Be a resident of Odisha.
2. Possess identity and residential proof, including an Aadhaar Card.
3. Have a bank account in their name in the State of Odisha.
4. Possess a QR-coded Aadhaar Card.

faqs.question: Can beneficiaries outside Odisha avail themselves of the Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, beneficiaries must be residents of Odisha to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can a beneficiary who received financial assistance for a boat or engine within the last five years still apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the beneficiary should not have received any financial assistance from the Government /any Agency towards the purchase of any new boat/engine in the last 5 Years (the beneficiary should not have availed of subsidy after 1st April 2018) and net in the last 3 Years (the beneficiary should not have availed subsidy after 1st April 2020).

faqs.question: How is the term "beneficiary family" defined under the eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: While availing subsidy, beneficiary family will be considered instead of individual member of family. One beneficiary family should not be provided with multiple benefits under one particular scheme. A family will not be eligible for subsidy under the same scheme if any of its members has got subsidy during last three years.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The fishermen interested to avail of the subsidy shall apply Go-Sugam Portal through a registration process submitting requisite documents. In case the difficulty is encountered in online mode, he/she can submit the application in offline mode through the AFO ME unit in the prescribed format (Annexure--I) to the respective Additional Fisheries Officers (Marine) / DFO (B&T), Balugaon.
