name: Establishment of Poultry Valley (Poultry Farming)
description: ﻿The scheme "Establishment of Poultry Valley" was launched by the Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Uttarakhand, with the aim of promoting poultry farming for self-reliance and income generation among farmers. Under this scheme, poultry farmers are supported in rearing 750 chicks annually in three phases. Each year, 500 one-day-old chicks will be provided to farmers by the Animal Husbandry Department from the State Sector Budget through Multipurpose Primary Agricultural Credit Societies (MPACS), while the remaining 250 chicks will be arranged by the farmer. The scheme also supports farmers by providing interest-free loans for the construction of poultry sheds and the rearing of chicks.
benefits: Each farmer will rear 750 chicks in 3 phases annually.The Animal Husbandry Department will provide 500 one-day-old chicks through MPACS from the state sector budget

and the farmer will bear the cost of the remaining 250 chicks.The Cooperative Department will provide interest-free loans for the construction of poultry sheds and for the care and rearing of the chicks.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a native of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be a member of a Multi-Purpose Agricultural Cooperative Society (MPACS).The applicant should be a farmer interested in poultry farming.The applicant should not have any loan or borrowing from any bank or Multi-Purpose Primary Agricultural Credit Society (MPACS).The beneficiary should not be a defaulter of any government or private institution.The applicant should be eligible to take a loan under the Deendayal Upadhyaya Krishi Kalyan Yojana.The applicant should have their own land or a registered lease/patta land.The applicant should be able to arrange for the remaining 250 chicks on their own.Priority will be given to women beneficiaries.
required_documents: Aadhaar CardBank Account DetailsLand/lease related documentsAffidavit/certificate of not being a defaulter from any bankAny other documents if required

faqs.question: How many chicks will a farmer rear under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Each farmer will rear 750 chicks annually in three phases.

faqs.question: How are the chicks provided to the farmers?
faqs.answer: The Animal Husbandry Department will provide 500 one-day-old chicks annually through MPACS, while the remaining 250 chicks must be arranged by the farmer.

faqs.question: What financial support does the scheme offer to farmers?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides interest-free loans for the construction of poultry sheds and the rearing of chicks.

faqs.question: Who can avail of the benefits of scheme?
faqs.answer: Farmers who are members of MPACS and are interested in poultry farming can avail the benefits.

faqs.question: Is there any priority for women applicants?
faqs.answer: Yes, priority will be given to women beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How is the poultry farming process supported under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Animal Husbandry Department provides chicks, while the Cooperative Department supports farmers with interest-free loans for shed construction and chick care.

faqs.question: Where can I apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: You can visit the nearest office of the Cooperation Department or the office of the Veterinary Officer to apply.

faqs.question: Can a farmer apply without land ownership?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant must have their own land or a registered lease/patta land to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can I apply if I have a loan from a bank or MPACS?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant should not have any loan or borrowing from any bank or MPACS.

faqs.question: How can I get the loan for constructing poultry sheds?
faqs.answer: The loan for constructing poultry sheds is provided by the Cooperative Department as an interest-free loan.

faqs.question: Will the scheme provide any training for poultry farming?
faqs.answer: No.

name: Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture Sub Scheme Horticulture Mission for North East and Himalayan Region- Meghalaya
description: The “Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH) Scheme” is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, launched by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Government of India, for the holistic growth of the horticulture sector covering fruits, vegetables, root & tuber crops, mushrooms, spices, flowers, aromatic plants, coconut, cashew, cocoa, and bamboo. Under MIDH, Government of India (GOI) contributes 60%, of the total outlay for developmental programmes in all the states except states in North East and Himalayas, and 40% share is contributed by State Governments. In the case of North Eastern States and Himalayan States, GOI contributes 90%. MIDH also provides technical advice and administrative support to State Governments/ State Horticulture Missions (SHMs) for the Saffron Mission and other horticulture-related activities Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY)/NMSA. In the state of Meghalaya, the Scheme “Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH) Sub Scheme Horticulture Mission for North East and Himalayan Region (HMNEH)” is implemented by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya with the following objectives:To promote holistic growth of the Horticulture sector through promotion, extension, post-harvest management, processing, and marketing.To encourage aggregation of farmers into farmer groups like FIGs/FPOs and FPCs to bring economy of scale and scope, enhance horticulture production, augment farmers, income, and strengthen nutritional security.To improve productivity by way of quality germplasm, planting material, and water use efficiency through Micro Irrigation, support skill development, and create employment generation opportunities for rural youth in horticulture and post-harvest management.
benefits: Pattern of Assistance:Production of planting materials
area expansion
rejuvenation of senile plantation
creation of water sources
protected horticulture
beekeeping
mechanization
post-harvest
and establishment of market infrastructures.Type of Assistance:Grant in Aid
Subsidy sales of inputs
training
and demonstration
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.The applicant should possess owned or leased land of at least 0.2 hectares or more.
required_documents: 1.	Passport-size photograph2.	Identity Proof3.	Bank passbook/account details4.	Documents proof of possessing own or leased land5.	Any other document as required

faqs.question: What is the "Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH)" Scheme?
faqs.answer: The MIDH Scheme is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme launched by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Government of India. It aims at the holistic growth of the horticulture sector, covering a wide array of crops including fruits, vegetables, root & tuber crops, mushrooms, spices, flowers, aromatic plants, coconut, cashew, cocoa, and bamboo.

faqs.question: How is the funding for MIDH allocated between the Government of India and the State Governments?
faqs.answer: Under the MIDH Scheme, the Government of India contributes 60% of the total outlay for developmental programs in all states, except those in the North East and Himalayan regions, where the contribution is 90%.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer: Production of planting materials, area expansion, rejuvenation of senile plantation, creation of water sources, protected horticulture, bee keeping, mechanisation, post harvest and establishment of market infrastructures.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance?
faqs.answer: Grant in Aid, Subsidy sales of inputs, training and demonstration.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers engaged in Agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 0.2 (hectares) or more can apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers shall be selected on a first come first basis.

faqs.question: Whom to contact?
faqs.answer:
1. District Horticulture Officer
2. Managing Director, MgSFAC (Meghalaya Small Farmers' Agri-Business Consortium)
3. Horticulture Development Officer

name: Assistance for Tools, Equipment, Shorting/Grading Equipment, PHM Equipment for General Category (HRT-2)
description: The scheme “Assistance for Tools, Equipment, Shorting/Grading Equipment, PHM Equipment for General Category (HRT-2)” is implemented by the Directorate of Horticulture, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat. Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to farmers belonging to the General Category as well as to farmer groups and cooperative societies for purchasing various tools, equipment, sorting/grading equipment, and Post-Harvest Management (PHM) equipment. This includes plastic crates with equipment such as weights, packing materials, sorting/grading machinery, etc.
benefits: The General Category farmers will be eligible for assistance up to 75% of the cost of the Tools/Equipment or ₹3
whichever is less.Farmer groups/cooperative societies will be eligible for assistance of 90% of the cost of equipment or up to ₹7
whichever is less
for the installation of Post-Harvest Management (PHM) Equipment.
eligibility_criteria: The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Gujarat.The beneficiary should belong to the General Category.The individual farmer or farmer groups/Cooperative Societies are eligible to avail benefits under the scheme.Note 01: The tool/equipment has to be purchased from the authorised dealer of the empanelled manufacturer for the purpose of price discovery as notified by the Department of Agriculture from time to time.Note 02: Companies empanelled by the Department of Agriculture for tarpaulin seats and their regulations will have to be implemented as per the norms.Note 03: Companies empanelled by the Department of Agriculture for plastic crates and their regulations will have to be implemented as per the norms.
required_documents: Copy of Aadhaar CardDisability Certificate issued by Competent Authority (only for PWDs) (if applicable)Copy of land details 7/12 and 8-ACopy of bank passbook/ cancelled chequeCopy of forest rights Letter (if applicable) Any other documents as required

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from the scheme?
faqs.answer: Permanent residents of Gujarat belonging to the General Category, as well as individual farmers and farmer groups/cooperative societies, are eligible to avail benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is available for General Category farmers under the scheme
faqs.answer: General Category farmers are eligible for assistance up to 75% of the cost of the tools/equipment or ₹3,750/-, whichever is less.

faqs.question: What assistance is available for farmer groups/cooperative societies under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Farmer groups/cooperative societies are eligible for assistance of 90% of the cost of equipment or up to ₹7,50,000/-, whichever is less, for the installation of Post-Harvest Management (PHM) Equipment.

faqs.question: What types of equipment are covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers various tools, equipment, sorting/grading equipment, and Post-Harvest Management (PHM) equipment, including plastic crates with equipment such as weights, packing materials, sorting/grading machinery, etc.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for beneficiaries under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries must be permanent residents of Gujarat and belong to the General Category.

faqs.question: Can farmer groups and cooperative societies avail benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, farmer groups and cooperative societies are eligible to avail benefits under the scheme along with individual farmers.

faqs.question: Are there any specific purchasing guidelines for the tools/equipment under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The tools/equipment must be purchased from authorized dealers of empanelled manufacturers to ensure price discovery as notified by the Department of Agriculture.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply online through the I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/

faqs.question: Can applicants track their application status online?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx

name: Finance Assistant to PACS for Computerization and Integration of PACS through Core Banking System with District Cooperative Banks
description: The scheme "Finance Assistant to PACS for Computerization and Integration of PACS through Core Banking System with District Cooperative Banks" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to bring transparency, accuracy, and consistency in PACS accounts using a common accounting and management information system. By enabling PACS to be digitally connected with District and State Cooperative Banks through CBS, this scheme also boosts rural financial inclusion and ensures seamless banking facilities in remote areas.
benefits: ﻿Standard of AssistanceRemarksMinimum Time Limit (in Year) for Reclaiming Benefits)the cost is estimated at ₹ 3
369/- per PACS
out of which the Central Government's contribution is 60% at ₹1
441/- and State Government's contribution as per 40% per PACS ₹1

627/- will be incurred.The agency empaneled by NABARD on behalf of the Government of India for the performance of software training while the procurement of hardware is to be done by the state government.There is no provision regarding re-benefit.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The benefit of this scheme will be available only to Primary Agricultural Credit Co-operative Societies (Including PACS
LAMP

and FSS).The statutory audit of the Primary Agricultural Credit Co-operative Societies (PACS) up to the last financial year should have been completed.The Primary Agricultural Credit Co-operative Societies (PACS) benefiting from this scheme should have their own or leased premises.The Secretary of the Primary Agricultural Credit Cooperative Societies (PACS) should be a salaried employee.Primary Agricultural Credit Cooperative Societies (PACS) benefiting from this scheme should have telecom data network facility.There should be computer literate staff at Primary Agricultural Credit Cooperative Societies (PACS) for smooth implementation of the scheme.PACS should be selected in the District Level Implementation and Monitoring Committee (DLIMC) at the district level.The PACS selected in the State Level Implementation and Monitoring Committee (SLIMC) of the State level in the District Level Implementation and Monitoring Committee (DLIMC) should have been approved in the SLIMC.
required_documents: Copy of completed statutory audit report for the last financial year.Proof of ownership or lease of premises.Employment proof of salaried Secretary.Documentation of telecom/data network facility.Proof of computer literacy of PACS staff.Approval/selection proof from DLIMC and SLIMC.Any other document as required.

faqs.question: What is the main objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The main objective of the scheme is to computerize and integrate Primary Agricultural Credit Societies (PACS) with the Core Banking System (CBS) of District Cooperative Banks in order to improve accuracy, transparency, and efficiency in rural banking.﻿﻿

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only Primary Agricultural Credit Co-operative Societies (PACS), including LAMPs and FSS, that meet all the specified eligibility criteria are allowed to apply for the scheme.﻿﻿

faqs.question: What is the total financial assistance provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The total cost estimated per PACS is ₹3,91,369/-, out of which ₹1,85,441/- (60%) is contributed by the Central Government and ₹1,23,627/-(40%) by the State Government.﻿﻿

faqs.question: Who is responsible for providing software training under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Software training is provided by agencies that are empaneled by NABARD on behalf of the Government of India.﻿﻿

faqs.question: Who is responsible for procuring the hardware under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The procurement of hardware under the scheme is managed by the State Government.﻿﻿

faqs.question: How are PACS selected for inclusion in the scheme?
faqs.answer: PACS are first selected by the District Level Implementation and Monitoring Committee (DLIMC) and then approved by the State Level Implementation and Monitoring Committee (SLIMC), before receiving final approval from the National Level Implementation and Monitoring Committee (NLIMC).﻿﻿

faqs.question: Can a PACS without computer-literate staff is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, having computer-literate staff is mandatory for eligibility under this scheme.﻿﻿

faqs.question: Is it necessary for a PACS to have a data network facility to be eligible?
faqs.answer: Yes, having telecom or data network facilities is a required eligibility criterion.﻿﻿

faqs.question: What is the role of the State Level Implementation and Monitoring Committee (SLIMC)?
faqs.answer: SLIMC is responsible for reviewing and approving the list of PACS selected by DLIMC and forwarding the final approved list to NABARD.﻿﻿

faqs.question: Who should be contacted in case of doubts or issues with the application process?
faqs.answer: Applicants may contact their District Cooperative Officer or the Project Monitoring Unit (PMU) of NABARD for assistance and clarification regarding the application process.

name: "Financial Grant for Reactivation of Mechanised Boats" under "Financial Assistance for Availing Subsidy Components for the Development of Marine Fisheries"
description: The scheme "Financial Grant for Reactivation of Mechanised Boats" is a Sub-Component under the Umbrella Scheme "Financial Assistance for Availing Subsidy Components for the Development of Marine Fisheries" by the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The scheme is introduced with the objective of increasing marine fish production by extending financial grants for the reactivation of wooden/steel mechanized boats.
benefits: A financial grant for the reactivation of a registered wooden/steel mechanized boat will be extended at ₹ 10
000 per boat and ₹ 5
000 for a registered fiber-reinforced plastic mechanized boat.*The grant is subject to revision as and when approved by the Government from time to time.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should either belong to the fishermen community or be one of those professionally engaged in fishing/fish trade occupation on a full-time basis/prospective entrepreneurs.The applicant must have resided in the Union territory of Puducherry for a continuous period of not less than five years at the time of applying for extending subsidies/ grants. The applicant must have been enrolled as a member of the Fishermen Co-operative Society and be above the age of 23 years and below 60 years.The applicant must not have been a recipient of Old Age Pension

issued by the department. The applicant should not be employed in Government/ Government Undertakings/Fishermen Co-operative Society. The applicant must not have any dues to be paid to the Department/Fishermen Co-operative Societies at the time of making the application.The applicant should possess a registered mechanized boat. The applicant should have carried out overhauling/ repairs to the engine/hull during the notified fishing ban period and should not have ventured fishing during the notified ban on fishing periods.
required_documents: Passport Sized Photograph.Aadhaar Card.Election Photo Identity Card (for Proof of Identity).Ration Card (for Proof of Address).Birth Certificate (for Proof of Age).Membership Certificate from the President/Administrator of Fishermen/Fisherwoman Co-operative Society (in the case of fishermen).Document attesting full-time engagement in fishing or fish trade occupation (in the case of Fish Traders).Residence Certificate indicating a continuous period of not less than five years in the Union territory of Puducherry (from Deputy Tahsildar of the Area of Residence).Enrollment certificate as a member of the Fishermen Co-operative Society.Declaration of not being a recipient of Old Age Pension.Declaration of not being employed in Government/Government Undertakings/Fishermen Co-operative Society.Declaration certifying that the applicant has no outstanding dues to the Department/Fishermen Co-operative Societies at the time of application.Proof of possession of a registered mechanized boat. Proof of overhauling/ repairs to the engine/hull during the notified fishing ban period.A declaration/affidavit that the applicant has not ventured for fishing during the notified ban on fishing periods.

faqs.question: How is the genuineness of applications verified?
faqs.answer: Applications undergo field inquiry by an officer not below the rank of Sub-Inspector of Fisheries, with verification and recommendations by the scheme implementing officer, typically an Assistant Director or Deputy Director of Fisheries.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions on employment for eligible applicants?
faqs.answer: Yes, eligible applicants should not be employed in Government, Government Undertakings, or Fishermen Co-operative Society at the time of application.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Departmental Selection Committee in the selection process?
faqs.answer: The Committee, headed by the Director of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, is responsible for selecting beneficiaries based on shortlisted eligible applicants, ensuring a fair and transparent process.

faqs.question: Who comprises the Departmental Selection Committee for the Puducherry region?
faqs.answer: The Committee includes the Director of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Joint Director, Deputy Director (Welfare), Secretary of Puducherry State Fishermen Co-operative Federation Limited, and Deputy Director (Mechanisation).

faqs.question: What is the timeline for shortlisting eligible beneficiaries after field inquiry work commences?
faqs.answer: Eligible beneficiaries are shortlisted within 60 days from the commencement of field inquiry work, ensuring a prompt and efficient selection process.

faqs.question: Can applicants be above the age of 60 and still qualify?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must be below the age of 60 to be eligible for subsidies and grants under these rules.

faqs.question: Can a person engaged in fish trade qualify for subsidies?
faqs.answer: Yes, individuals engaged in fishing or fish trade occupations, including fish traders, are eligible for subsidies under these rules.

faqs.question: Can applicants with outstanding dues qualify for subsidies?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must not have any outstanding dues to the Department/Fishermen Co-operative Societies at the time of application to be eligible for subsidies.

faqs.question: What is the financial grant provided for the reactivation of a registered fiber-reinforced plastic mechanized boat, and is there a possibility of revision?
faqs.answer: The financial grant for reactivation is ₹5,000 per boat, and it is subject to revision upon government approval.

faqs.question: Are there specific guidelines on the types of mechanized boats eligible for the grant, and how is the grant amount determined?
faqs.answer: The grant is applicable to wooden/steel and fiber-reinforced plastic mechanized boats, with ₹10,000 and ₹5,000 amounts respectively.

faqs.question: Who comprises the Departmental Selection Committee for the Puducherry region?
faqs.answer: The Committee includes the Director of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Joint Director, Deputy Director (Welfare), Secretary of Puducherry State Fishermen Co-operative Federation Limited, and Deputy Director (Mechanisation).

name: Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme
description: The "Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme" launched by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial aid to farmers for the purchase of various modern farm implements and machinery. The scheme promotes mechanized farming and ensures timely agricultural operations for better yield and efficiency.﻿﻿
benefits: Financial Assistance: An amount between ₹1
000/- for purchasing various farm implements.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a farmer.The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.﻿﻿﻿﻿
required_documents: 7/12 Certificate (land ownership proof).Aadhaar Card.Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque.

faqs.question: What is the "Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme"?
faqs.answer: The "Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme" is a state government initiative in Gujarat that provides financial assistance to farmers for purchasing modern agricultural machinery.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Any individual who is a farmer and a resident of Gujarat is eligible to apply for this scheme, regardless of caste, income, or social status.﻿﻿

faqs.question: What types of machinery are supported under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme supports the purchase of various farm implements such as tractors, power tillers, seed drills, threshers, and other agricultural tools.﻿﻿

faqs.question: How much financial assistance can a farmer receive under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A farmer can receive financial assistance ranging from ₹1,200/- to ₹11,00,000/- depending on the type and cost of the machinery.﻿﻿

faqs.question: How is the subsidy amount disbursed to the applicant?
faqs.answer: The approved subsidy amount is directly credited to the applicant's bank account.﻿﻿

faqs.question: How can a farmer apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: A farmer can apply online through the official  i-Khedut portal of the Gujarat government by filling in the application form and uploading the required documents.﻿﻿

faqs.question: What documents must be submitted with the application?
faqs.answer: The applicant must submit a copy of the 7/12 land record, Aadhaar card, and a bank passbook or a cancelled cheque.﻿﻿

faqs.question: What are the consequences of submitting false information in the application?
faqs.answer: If false or incorrect information is submitted, the application may be rejected, and the applicant could face legal action.﻿﻿

faqs.question: Where can applicants seek help if they face difficulties during the application process?
faqs.answer: Applicants can visit the nearest agriculture office or contact the helpline number provided on the ikhedut portal for assistance.

name: Madilu Kit
description: The Madilu Programme is a comprehensive initiative implemented by the government to uplift rural communities by providing them with the necessary skills and resources to improve their livelihoods. The program primarily focuses on skill development, entrepreneurship, and capacity building. By equipping individuals with relevant skills, such as agricultural techniques, handicraft production, and small business management, the Madilu Programme aims to create sustainable income-generating opportunities within rural areas.﻿Through targeted training sessions, workshops, and mentorship programs, participants are empowered to harness their potential and establish small-scale enterprises. The Madilu Programme also facilitates access to micro-financing options and provides guidance on market linkages, enabling participants to establish viable businesses and gain financial independence. Additionally, the program emphasizes the importance of gender equality and social inclusion, ensuring that marginalized groups have equal access to opportunities and benefits.
benefits: Empowerment of rural communities through skill development and entrepreneurship.Creation of sustainable livelihoods and reduction of poverty.Enhancement of social and economic well-being in rural areas.Increased income-generating opportunities for participants.Access to micro-financing options and market linkages.Promotion of gender equality and social inclusion.Strengthening of rural economies and local industries.
eligibility_criteria: Individuals residing in rural areas are eligible to participate.Participants should have a willingness to learn and engage in skill development activities.There is no age restriction for participation in the program.Both men and women are encouraged to apply.Participants should demonstrate an interest in entrepreneurship and improving their livelihoods
required_documents: Completed application form (obtained from the Madilu Programme website or Rural Development Office)Personal identification documents (e.g.
Aadhaar card
passport
or voter ID)Proof of residence (e.g.
utility bill
ration card

or land ownership document)Educational certificates or qualifications (if applicable)Certificates or documentation showcasing previous skills or entrepreneurial experience (if applicable)Income certificate or proof of income (if required for specific program benefits)Any other supporting documents relevant to the application or specific program requirements

faqs.question: Who can apply for the Madilu Programme?
faqs.answer: Individuals residing in rural areas who are interested in skill development and entrepreneurship can apply for the Madilu Programme.

faqs.question: Is there an age restriction for participation?
faqs.answer: No, there is no age restriction. People of all age groups can apply for the Madilu Programme.

faqs.question: Is there any financial assistance provided through the program?
faqs.answer: While the Madilu Programme does not provide direct financial grants or subsidies, it facilitates access to micro-financing options for eligible participants.

faqs.question: How long is the program duration?
faqs.answer: The program duration may vary depending on the specific training modules and entrepreneurial support provided. It typically ranges from several weeks to a few months.

faqs.question: Are there any fees or charges associated with the program?
faqs.answer: The Madilu Programme is generally free of charge for selected participants. However, participants may be responsible for their own travel expenses, accommodation, or materials required for certain activities.

faqs.question: Can I apply for multiple skill development areas?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can express your interest in multiple skill development areas on the application form. However, the final selection will be based on program availability and eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Is the Madilu Programme available in all states?
faqs.answer: The Madilu Programme is implemented nationwide; however, program availability and specific modules may vary depending on the region and local initiatives.

faqs.question: Can I start my own business after completing the program?
faqs.answer: Yes, one of the main objectives of the Madilu Programme is to empower participants to establish their own businesses and become self-reliant.

name: Grant of 50% Subsidy for the Purchase of Aquarium and Its Accessories under "Development of Freshwater Aquaculture and Setting up of Aquarium, Ornamental Fish Breeding Centre"
description: The scheme "Grant of 50% Subsidy for the Purchase of Aquarium and Its Accessories" is a Sub-Component under the scheme "Development of Freshwater Aquaculture and Setting up of Aquarium, Ornamental Fish Breeding Centre”. The scheme is extended to all the regions of the Union territory of Puducherry. The scheme is introduced with the objective to propagate the importance of aquarium keeping and to inculcate the art of aquarium keeping among the general public.
benefits: The department has assessed the unit cost for the aquarium and its accessories at ₹ 7
000 per unit. The aquarium proposed to be issued to the beneficiaries consists of one aquarium/moulded aquarium
one stand
one power filter
one air pump
two numbers of 1’ tube lights
10 kgs. of gravel
9 numbers of gold fishes
1 number of 100 grams fish food pocket and one number of scoop net.﻿Pattern of Assistance (in ₹)Unit cost: 7
000 (Maximum)* 50% subsidy by Government: 3
500 (Maximum)* 50% and above the cost of an aquarium to be paid by the beneficiary to the Secretary/Administrator of PSFCF/ KFCMU/ Fishermen Co-operative Societies in Mahe and Yanam: 3
500 (Maximum)* * May vary from time to time.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of the Union territory of Puducherry by domicile or by birth.The applicant should have attained 18 years of age.The applicant or their family member should not have benefited under the scheme previously. The applicant should possess a pucca house/commercial place to keep an aquarium.
required_documents: Aadhar Identity Card and Smart CardResident Certificate of Union Territory of Puducherry (from Deputy Tahsildar of the Area of Residence)Proof of AgeRation Card as a Proof of His/Her Residential AddressElectoral Identity Card/PAN Card/Driving Licence as a Photo Identity ProofProof of Possession of a Pucca House/Commercial PlaceDeclaration

faqs.question: Can an applicant be considered if they or their family member has benefited from the scheme previously?
faqs.answer: No, applicants or their family members should not have benefited under the scheme previously to be considered eligible.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Deputy Director of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare in the Selection Committee?
faqs.answer: In Puducherry region, the Deputy Director of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare (Inland) serves as a member and convener of the Selection Committee.

faqs.question: How is the commencement of the rules for the subsidy determined?
faqs.answer: The rules come into force on the date of their publication in the official gazette.

faqs.question: Can an applicant specify the size of the aquarium they want to purchase under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants should specify the size of the aquarium they want to purchase, as shown in the application form, for subsidised rate consideration.

faqs.question: What is the methodology of selection recommended by the Field Officers?
faqs.answer: Field Officers recommend applications based on the location of the applicant's house or residential place to the Selection Committee.

faqs.question: What is the target group for the aquarium subsidy scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme targets residents of the Union territory of Puducherry who fulfill the specified eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: What is the significance of the term "KFCMU" in the guidelines?
faqs.answer: "KFCMU" stands for 'The Karaikal Fishermen Co-operative Marketing Union, Karaikal,' one of the designated offices for obtaining Form-I in Karaikal region.

faqs.question: What is the Pattern of Assistance for purchasing an aquarium under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The unit cost is ₹7,000, with a 50% subsidy by the government (₹3,500), and the beneficiary contributes the remaining 50% to the Secretary/Administrator of PSFCF/KFCMU/Fishermen Co-operative Societies.

faqs.question: Can you explain the role of the Pondicherry State Fishermen Co-operative Federation Limited (PSFCF) in the application process?
faqs.answer: PSFCF is one of the designated offices where applicants can obtain Form-I for benefiting under the scheme, and it plays a role in the application submission process.

faqs.question: What is the scope of an aquarium, as mentioned in the guidelines?
faqs.answer: An aquarium is described as an artifact that adds beauty to its surroundings, brings solace to the aged, soothes children, and helps reduce stress.

faqs.question: What is the maximum subsidy provided by the government for the purchase of an aquarium?
faqs.answer: The government provides a maximum subsidy of ₹3,500, covering 50% of the total unit cost of ₹7,000.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Selection Committee in the process of beneficiary selection?
faqs.answer: The Selection Committee, chaired by the Director of Fisheries, reviews recommended applications, ensuring the necessary documents are enclosed, and selects beneficiaries.

name: Seed Farms Scheme
description: The “Seed Farms Scheme” is a State Plan Scheme, which is implemented by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya. The objective of the scheme is the production of high-quality seeds of cereals, pulses, oilseeds etc., and for raising Horticultural seedlings such as orange, coconut, arecanut, etc. for distribution to cultivators.
benefits: Pattern of Assistance:Supply of quality seeds to farmers.Type of Assistance and Entitlement (If any):Subsidy sale
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Meghalaya.The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.
required_documents: Passport-size photographIdentity ProofDocuments proof of having sufficient available cultivable landAny other document as required

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is the production of high quality seeds of cereals, pulses, oilseeds etc. and for raising Horticultural seedlings such as orange, coconut, arecanut etc. for distribution to cultivators.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department Of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers who have sufficient available cultivable land and are engaged in agriculture can apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer: Supply of quality seeds to farmers.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/service?
faqs.answer: Subsidy sale to farmers.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Agriculture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers having sufficient available cultivable land shall be selected on a first come first served basis.

name: Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme
description: The Madhya Pradesh government has launched a nationwide Artificial Insemination (AI) programme to improve the reproductive health of livestock and enhance the productivity of livestock. The programme is being implemented with the help of the Department of Animal Husbandry, Dairying and Fisheries, the Government of India and the National Dairy Development Board. Through this programme, AI technicians will be trained at the district level and AI services will be provided to the farmers. The programme will focus on the use of quality semen and improved scientific techniques for better reproductive performance. The programme also aims to reduce the cost of artificial insemination for the farmers. The programme is expected to help the farmers to improve their income and the overall economic condition of the state
benefits: Increased fertility rate: The programme will help to increase the fertility rate by providing access to artificial insemination services. This will help to improve the fertility rate of cows
buffaloes

goats and sheep in the state. Improved quality of livestock: The programme will help to improve the quality of livestock through the use of improved semen from superior bulls. This will help to improve the production of milk and meat as well as the quality of the animals.Improved animal health: Artificial insemination will help to improve the health of animals by reducing the spread of diseases. This will help to reduce the number of deaths of animals due to disease.Increased production: The programme will help to increase the production of milk and meat
which will help to improve the economic status of farmers.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The livestock owner should be a resident of Madhya Pradesh. The applicant should have valid livestock registration documents. The applicant should have the required infrastructure to undertake AI operations. The applicant should not belong to any of the scheduled castes and tribes. The applicant should have the required knowledge and skill to undertake AI operations. The applicant should not have any prior criminal record.﻿
required_documents: Proof of Identity: A valid government-issued photo ID such as an Aadhaar Card
Passport
or Voter ID Card. Proof of Address: A valid government-issued proof of address such as an Aadhaar Card
Passport
Voter ID Card
Utility Bills
or Ration Card. Medical Records: A copy of the last medical examination report

including the results of any tests conducted. Consent Forms: A completed and signed consent form from both the donor and the recipient. Photographs: A recent photograph of both the donor and the recipient﻿

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme in Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: The Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme in Madhya Pradesh offers a range of benefits to the farmers, including: improved crop yields, increased access to high-quality inputs, improved access to finance, access to improved technologies, and enhanced access to markets. Additionally, the programme also helps to strengthen farmers' livelihoods, increase their income, and reduce their vulnerability to weather-related risks

faqs.question: How will the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme help farmers in Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: The Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme in Madhya Pradesh will help farmers by providing access to improved technologies, improved crop yields, increased access to high-quality inputs, improved access to finance, and enhanced access to markets. These benefits will help farmers to strengthen their livelihoods, increase their income, and reduce their vulnerability to weather-related risks.

faqs.question: What kind of financial assistance is available through the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme in Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: The Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme in Madhya Pradesh provides farmers with access to improved financial services, including access to credit, insurance, and other financial products. Additionally, the programme also provides access to improved technologies, which can help to reduce the cost of production and increase efficiency.

faqs.question: What kind of technologies are available through the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme in Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: The Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme in Madhya Pradesh provides access to improved technologies, such as precision agriculture, drought-resistant seed varieties, and advanced irrigation systems.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria to participate in the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme?
faqs.answer: The Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme is open to all dairy farmers in India, including those in Madhya Pradesh. Farmers must have a minimum of five cows in their herd and must have a valid milk producers federation card. They must also have access to quality semen and a trained technician to perform the insemination. The programme is open to farmers from all socio-economic backgrounds.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit to participate in the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no age limit to participate in the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme.

faqs.question: Is there a cost associated with participating in the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is a cost associated with participating in the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme. The cost of the semen and technician fees vary depending on the location and availability.

faqs.question: Are there any additional requirements to participate in the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme?
faqs.answer: Yes, farmers must have a valid milk producers federation card and a trained technician to perform the insemination.

faqs.question: Is there any support available to farmers who participate in the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme?
faqs.answer: Yes, farmers who participate in the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme may be eligible for financial assistance through the government. Additionally, the programme provides training and technical support to farmers to help them improve the quality of their milk production

faqs.question: What is the purpose of the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: The purpose of the Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme Madhya Pradesh is to improve the quality of livestock in the state by providing artificial insemination services to farmers. This will help to increase the productivity of livestock, ultimately leading to increased incomes for farmers.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the programme?
faqs.answer: The programme is open to all livestock farmers in Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the programme?
faqs.answer: Interested farmers can submit an application form to the Department of Animal Husbandry in their respective districts. The application form is available on the department’s website

faqs.question: What documents do I need to submit with my application?
faqs.answer: Along with the application form, you must submit proof of identity, proof of address, and proof of ownership of livestock.

name: Meghalaya Agriculture Response Vehicle Scheme
description: The scheme “Meghalaya Agriculture Response Vehicle Scheme” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya, aims to provide 50% financial aid to buy commercial vehicles by 200 selected beneficiaries for agriculture transport. These vehicles will help the community involved in agriculture and allied sectors to transport their agricultural products and raw materials. The scheme also focuses on the economic upliftment of farmers by providing them with transportation at a competitive cost.Objectives:To increase the profitability of farmers by providing access to the market by supporting them with a mobility solution.To provide a mobility solution to various registered farmer’s associations which will increase aggregation and their market reach.To lower the transportation cost for farmers by introducing agriculture response vehicles for farmers at each CD Block of the State.To encourage individual entrepreneurship among the rural community by supporting them to buy commercial vehicles thereby creating livelihood opportunities.
benefits: The following benefits are provided under the scheme:200 agriculture transport vehicles to be distributed across Meghalaya for individual entrepreneurs and any registered farmer’s organizations with 50% financial aid.Vehicles will be pre-fitted with GPS devices.Farmers will have access to more vehicles dedicated to agriculture transportation services.The Project Management Unit will help in the connection between the farmers and agriculture response vehicles when demand arises.Financing Plan:Financing of the vehicles to the selected beneficiaries of the scheme shall be done through any branch of Meghalaya Rural Bank (MRB).The bank will sanction 50% of the on-road vehicle cost of the beneficiary in the form of a term loan.Rate of interest and repayment schedule:Prevailing rate of interest shall be charged by the bank and the repayment schedule will be 5 years. MRB will keep the rate of interest as fixed for the complete loan term.Quantum and Nature of Financial Assistance:a) Down payment Support:1. Total down payment will be 50% of the on-road cost of the vehicle.Out of which
the Agriculture Department

Government of Meghalaya shall pay 90%.And the remaining 10% shall be paid by the beneficiary.b) EMI support:2. To reduce the burden of the operational cost on the beneficiaries in the first two years of his business
the Agriculture Department
GoM will support the beneficiary by paying:85% of the EMI in the first 6 months45% of the EMI for 7-12 months35% of the EMI for 13-24 months.3. For the rest of the EMIs after 24 months
the beneficiary shall bear 100% of the EMI/month.4. Overall

EMI support from the government is 20% of the total EMI to be paid.5. The maximum support from the government shall be based on the value of the selected models mentioned above.If the beneficiary selects a model which has a lower value than the selected model
support shall be 50% of the value of that model.If the beneficiary selects a model which has a higher value than the selected model
the beneficiary shall bear the extra cost associated with it.6. The vehicle shall be fitted with a GPS tracking device which will be included in the on-road price of the vehicle.
eligibility_criteria: Individual applicants:Individuals who are permanent residents of Meghalaya and are above 18 years and below 58 years of age are eligible for the scheme.The applicant must have a valid commercial driving license before buying the vehicle from the dealer.The applicant must provide valid government ID proof with an address such as Aadhaar Card
Voter ID
and Passport

etc.The applicant should not be a defaulter at any financial institution.Any registered farmer’s association:Any association of farmers involved with agricultural products and legally registered with the government of Meghalaya such as Cooperatives
Farmer Producer Companies (FPC)
Farmer Producer Organisation (FPO)

etc. are eligible to apply for the scheme.The association of farmers must provide an Incorporation Certificate or a registration certificate whichever is applicable.The Association of farmers should not be a defaulter at any financial institution.
required_documents: As proof of eligibility

the applicants are required to provide proof of their eligibility for the scheme by submitting the required documents mentioned below:For Individual Applicant:A valid government photo identity with an address such as Aadhaar Card

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide Small Commercial Vehicles and pickups at each CD Block across Meghalaya with 50% financial aid from the Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya

faqs.question: Who are the beneficiaries under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered farmer’s association and Individual entrepreneurs are the beneficiaries under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the percentage of financial aid provided to the beneficiary?
How many agriculture transport will be distributed across the state?
Which bank will be the financial agency?
faqs.answer: Financing of the vehicles to the selected beneficiaries of the scheme shall be done through any branch of Meghalaya Rural Bank (MRB).

faqs.question: What will be the repayment tenure?
faqs.answer: 5 years.

faqs.question: How to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The physical forms can be collected from the office of the District Agriculture Offices and after filling it, will need to hand over along with required documents to the District Agriculture Office at the Block office.

name: Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter Scheme under Tribal Area Sub Plan (TASP- ST Category)
description: The scheme “Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter Scheme under Tribal Area Sub Plan” is implemented by the Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat. Under this scheme, financial assistance is given to dairy farmers belonging to the Scheduled Tribes (ST) category on purchase of electric powered chaff cutters. By using power driven chaff cutter, dairy farmers can reduce wastage of green and dry fodder which is economically important for their profitable dairy farming.
benefits: Under the scheme
financial assistance up to 75% of the purchase cost of powered chaff cutter or ₹18
whichever is less
is given to beneficiaries of Scheduled Tribes category.  Note: The amount of assistance will be deposited in bank account of the beneficiary.
eligibility_criteria: The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Gujarat.The beneficiary should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category.The beneficiary should have a minimum of five (5) animals of his/her own.
required_documents: 1.	Identity proof of the applicant i.e. Aadhaar Card2.	Scheduled Tribe certificate3.	Proof of residence4.	Proof of possessing necessary animals5.	Bank account details of beneficiary6.	Any other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the purpose of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to assist dairy farmers in reducing wastage of green and dry fodder, which is important for profitable dairy farming.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligibility criteria include being a permanent resident of Gujarat, belonging to the Scheduled Tribe category, and owning a minimum of five animals.

faqs.question: What benefits does the scheme offer?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance of up to 75% of the purchase cost of the powered chaff cutter or ₹18,000/-, whichever is less, to beneficiaries belonging to the Scheduled Tribes category.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance provided?
faqs.answer: How is the financial assistance provided?

faqs.question: Where can I find the application for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply online through the I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/

faqs.question: How is the subsidy claimed after purchasing the chaff cutter?
faqs.answer: After purchasing the chaff cutter from a government-approved empanelled vendor, beneficiaries need to produce the bill for claim submission of the subsidy.

name: Grant of Subsidy for Procurement of Vehicle
description: Launched in 2010, the scheme "Grant of Subsidy for Procurement of Vehicle" is a Sub-Scheme under the Umbrella Scheme "Puducherry Development of Shore Based Facilities, Ice Plants, Service Unit, Infrastructural Facilities and Quick Transport Facilities" is a development scheme by the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The scheme aims to facilitate the quick transportation of fish catches from landing centers to marketing places, thereby preventing/minimizing spoilage of fish. It provides a 50% subsidy for the procurement of specified vehicles.
benefits: 50% subsidy for the purchase of auto goods carrier up to 1-ton capacity (maximum subsidy of ₹75
000).50% subsidy for the purchase of a mini truck with 1-3 ton capacity (maximum subsidy of ₹1
000).50% subsidy for the purchase of a mini lorry with 3-5 ton capacity (maximum subsidy of ₹3
000).50% subsidy for the purchase of an insulated fish van with 5-10 ton capacity (maximum subsidy of ₹5
000).50% subsidy for the purchase of a moped with an insulated ice-box (maximum subsidy of ₹15
000).50% subsidy for the purchase of engine spares for boats (maximum subsidy of ₹2
000 per boat per annum).﻿Mode of DisbursementThe subsidy amount will be released to the bank and credited to the account of the beneficiary for whom the loan amount was sanctioned by the bank.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should belong to the fishermen's community and must be a resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry by domicile or birth.The applicant's age should not be less than 18 years old or more than 50 years of age.The applicant should not have availed the benefit of a loan/subsidy under the scheme earlier for the purpose for which the subsidy is sought.The applicant should be a member of a Fishermen Cooperative Society and should not have any overdue with the society/department.The applicant should possess a driving license issued by the Transport Authority for driving a moped/auto goods carrier or transport vehicle.The applicant should not be employed in Government/Government undertakings/Societies either on a regular/part-time or temporary basis.
required_documents: Loan Sanction Order From the Bank.Quotation From the Dealer for the Vehicle.Driving License and Badge for Driving Moped/auto Goods Carrier or Transport Vehicle.Purchase Invoice Copies and Rc Book for Vehicle Verification.Copies of Mortgage Documents in Respect of the Beneficiary for Official Record.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Fishermen Cooperative Society in the application process?
faqs.answer: Being a member of a Fishermen Cooperative Society is a prerequisite, and applicants should not have any overdue with the society/department to be eligible for the subsidy.

faqs.question: Are there any specific guidelines for the verification of mortgage documents?
faqs.answer: Copies of mortgage documents in respect of the beneficiary are required for official record-keeping and verification purposes.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for reconsideration if an applicant's subsidy is initially declined?
faqs.answer: The scheme does not specify a provision for reconsideration once the Departmental Selection Committee has completed the shortlisting process.

faqs.question: Is there a specific format for submitting the application?
faqs.answer: Applicants need to submit the application in the prescribed format issued by the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy amount be utilized for purposes other than vehicle procurement?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is specifically intended for the purchase of specified vehicles and engine spares for boats as outlined in the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there a specific format for submitting the application?
faqs.answer: Applicants need to submit the application in the prescribed format issued by the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy be used for the purchase of engine spares for boats?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme offers a 50% subsidy for the purchase of engine spares for boats, with a maximum subsidy of ₹2,000 per boat per annum.

faqs.question: Are there any specific conditions for the driving license required for eligibility?
faqs.answer: The applicant should possess a driving license issued by the Transport Authority for driving moped/auto goods carrier or transport vehicle.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for producing documentary evidence for verification after vehicle purchase?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries need to produce documentary evidence for verification within 60 days of vehicle purchase.

faqs.question: What is the maximum subsidy amount for the purchase of a mini lorry?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a 50% subsidy for the purchase of a mini lorry with 3-5 ton capacity, with a maximum subsidy of ₹3,50,000.

faqs.question: Can a fisherman apply for subsidy without being a member of a Fishermen Cooperative Society?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant must be a member of a Fishermen Cooperative Society to be eligible for the subsidy.

faqs.question: How is the subsidy amount disbursed to the beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The subsidy amount is released to the bank and credited to the account of the beneficiary, as sanctioned by the bank.

name: Supply of Insulated Boxes
description: “Supply of Insulated Boxes” is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. Through this scheme, subsidy to the extent of 75% of the cost for the purchase of an insulated box of at least 50 liters capacity. The applications are accepted only in offline mode. Only the fisherman engaged in selling and marketing fish, fishing at sea with a canoe, and fishing at sea with a mechanized fishing vessel with up to 6-cylinder engines are eligible to apply to this scheme.
benefits: For the Beneficiary Engaged in Selling/Marketing FishOne insulated box of 50 liters capacity will be entitled to a subsidy to the extent of 75% of the cost limited to ₹ 1
500/-.For the Beneficiary Engaged in Fishing at Sea With a CanoeOne insulated box of 100 liters and one box of 220 liters capacity and subsidy to the extent of 75% of the cost limited to ₹ 7

000/- respectively.For the Beneficiary Engaged in Fishing at Sea With a Mechanized Fishing Vessel Upto 6 Cylinder EngineOne insulated box of 220 liters and one insulated box of 400 liters capacity and subsidy to the extent of 75% of the cost limited to ₹ 15
000/- respectively.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be one of the following - A fisherman engaged in selling and marketing fish.A fisherman engaged in fishing at sea with a canoe.A fisherman engaged in fishing at sea with a mechanized fishing vessel with up to 6-cylinder engines.
required_documents: For 400 & 220 Litres Capacity Insulated Boxes for Fishing Vessels:   a) Copy of VRC (Vessel Registration Certificate) of Fishing Vessel.   b) Latest copy of Updated Fishing License/Certificate.   c) Latest copy of Updated Net License Book.   d) Copy of Aadhaar Card.For 100 & 220 Litres Capacity Insulated Boxes for Fishing Canoes:   a) Copy of VRC (Vessel Registration Certificate) of Fishing Vessel.   b) Latest copy of Updated Fishing License/Certificate.   c) Latest copy of Updated Net License Book.   d) Copy of Aadhaar Card.For 50 Litres Capacity Insulated Boxes for Active Fish Sellers:   a) Certificate from Village Panchayat/Municipality indicating that the applicant is actively engaged in the retail sale of fish.   b) Copy of Aadhaar Card.

faqs.question: What is the address for submitting the duly filled and signed application form for the insulated boxes scheme?
faqs.answer: The application form should be submitted to the concerned authority at the Directorate of Fisheries, Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Panaji Goa, or to the official posted at BDO Office/Sub-Offices.

faqs.question: What are the contact details for the Directorate of Fisheries in Panaji Goa?
faqs.answer: The contact details are Tel: (O) 2224838, Tel: (Dir) 2227780, Fax: (0832) 2231049, Email: dir-fish.goa@nic.in, Website: www.fisheries.goa.gov.in.

faqs.question: How can citizens register dissatisfaction or complaints about the service standards of the Department of Fisheries?
faqs.answer: Citizens can register complaints with the Grievance Redressal Officer through dir-fish.goa@nic.in, and the final action will be communicated within 30 days.

faqs.question: What is the subsidy percentage for beneficiaries engaged in selling/marketing fish, fishing at sea with a canoe, and fishing at sea with a mechanized fishing vessel?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is 75% of the cost for all eligible beneficiaries, with varying limits depending on the capacity of the insulated box.

faqs.question: Where can citizens find the guidelines for the "Supply of Insulated Boxes" scheme?
faqs.answer: The guidelines are available on the Department of Fisheries website at https://fisheries.goa.gov.in/schemes-services/.

faqs.question: What is the process for submitting the application form for the insulated boxes scheme?
faqs.answer: The process involves taking a print of the prescribed application form, filling in all mandatory fields, attaching required documents, and submitting the form to the Directorate of Fisheries in Panaji Goa or to the official at BDO Office/Sub-Offices.

faqs.question: For the 50 liters capacity insulated boxes for active fish sellers, what certificates and documents are necessary?
faqs.answer: Required documents include a certificate from the Village Panchayat/Municipality indicating active engagement in the retail sale of fish and a copy of the Aadhaar Card.

faqs.question: What documents are needed for the 100 & 220 liters capacity insulated boxes for fishing canoes?
faqs.answer: The necessary documents include a copy of the Vessel Registration Certificate, the latest copy of the Fishing License/Certificate, the updated Net License Book, and a copy of the Aadhaar Card.

faqs.question: What documents are required for the 400 & 220 liters capacity insulated boxes for fishing vessels?
faqs.answer: Documents required include a copy of the Vessel Registration Certificate, the latest copy of the Fishing License/Certificate, the updated Net License Book, and a copy of the Aadhaar Card.

faqs.question: What are the benefits for beneficiaries engaged in selling/marketing fish, fishing at sea with a canoe, and fishing at sea with a mechanized fishing vessel?
faqs.answer: For selling/marketing fish, one insulated box of 50 liters is entitled to a 75% subsidy, limited to ₹1,500/-. For fishing at sea with a canoe, one 100-liter box and one 220-liter box receive a 75% subsidy, limited to ₹7,000/-. For fishing at sea with a mechanized vessel up to 6-cylinder engines, one 220-liter box and one 400-liter box get a 75% subsidy, limited to ₹15,000/-.

faqs.question: Are there any specific deadlines mentioned for submitting applications for the insulated boxes scheme?
faqs.answer: There are no application deadlines for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the application mode for the "Supply of Insulated Boxes" scheme, and is there any application fee?
faqs.answer: The application mode is offline, and there is no application fee.

name: Fruit Development Scheme
description: The scheme ‘Fruit Development Scheme’ was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya to make available to the farmers good quality planting materials in convergence mode and sale at subsidized rates.
benefits: Pattern of Assistance:Quality planting materials for sale at 50% subsidy and free of cost to the farmers under convergent mode with MGNREGA.Type of Assistance and Entitlement (If any):Sl. No.EntitlementOwantum of Assistance1To promote fruit cultivation by making available to farmers good quality planting materials including horticultural tools and implements.(i) 50% subsidy sale to the farmers. (ii) Free sampling of planting materials for convergent mode with MGNREGA.2Citrus rejuvenation programme for the senile orchard by providing planting materials for gap filling and organic-based plant protection measures.100% assistance.3Creeper fruit plants like- Kiwi
Grapes
etc. permanent trellies system are provided but planting and erection are to be done by farmers.75% subsidy assistance is limited to 500 sqm per beneficiary.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant/farmer should be a resident of Meghalaya.The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in Agriculture
possessing own or leased land of at least 0.2 (hectares) or more.Note: The applicant farmer can avail of the benefits of the scheme on a first come first serve basis.
required_documents: 1.	Passport-size photograph2.	Identity Proof3.	Bank passbook/account details4.	Documents proof of possessing own or leased land5.	Any other document as required

faqs.question: What is the key objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To make available to the farmers good quality planting materials in convergence mode and sale at subsidised rates.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya has launched this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance and entitlement?
faqs.answer:
1.	The Scheme assists in providing good quality planting materials including horticultural tools and implements at subsidized rates for promoting fruit cultivation.
2.	Providing organic-based plant protection measures for the Citrus rejuvenation programme of senile orchards.
3.	To assist farmers by providing a permanent trellis system for creeper fruit plants like Kiwi, Grapes etc, however, planting and erecting trellis are to be done by farmers themselves.
4.	Training and capacity building of farmers.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer:
I) 50% subsidy sale of planting materials, horticultural tools & implements.
ii) 100% assistance for citrus rejuvenation programme.
iii) 75% assistance limited to 500 sqm per beneficiary for permanent trellis.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers engaged in Agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 0.2 (hectares) or more.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers on first come first serve basis.

faqs.question: Whom to contact?
faqs.answer:
1. District Horticulture Officer
2. Horticulture Development Officer

name: Tea Development Scheme
description: The scheme “Tea Development Scheme” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya to continue the experimental plantation of tea and to find the possibility of growing tea economically as well as on a commercial scale. Further, seedlings are raised in the experimental station and distributed free to farmers.
benefits: Pattern of Assistance:Seedlings are offered for sale at the rate ₹1/- per tea seedling and one-time financial assistance at the rate ₹10
000/- per hectare.PP chemicals
equipment
brush cutters
tea harvesters

etc. on sale at the rate of 50% subsidy.Type of Assistance and Entitlement (If any):Sl. No.EntitlementOwantum of Assistance1Training programme to the Tea Growers at Village100% assistance2To promote tea plantation by providing tea seedlings to the growers at the District level/ Tea Development Centre.₹1/- per seedling sale to the growers3Sale of Bio fertilizers
Bio pesticides
Bio fungicides
equipment
etc. to the tea growers by Tea Development Centre situated at Umsning
Rongram
Riangdo.50% subsidy sale to the growers.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant/farmer should be a resident of Meghalaya.The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in Agriculture
possessing own or leased land of not exceeding 2 Ha/family.Note: The applicant farmer can avail of the benefits of the scheme on a first come first serve basis.
required_documents: 1.	Passport-size photograph2.	Identity Proof3.	Bank passbook/account details4.	Documents proof of possessing own or leased land5.	Any other document as required

faqs.question: What is the key objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer:
1.	To carry out experimental plantation of tea for the possibility of finding ways to grow tea economically and in a commercial scale as well.
2.	Raising seedlings in the experimental station for distribution to farmers.
3.	Encouraging Organic Certification on a cluster-based approach.
4.	Training and capacity building to Tea growers.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya has launched this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/service?
faqs.answer: Providing tea seedlings, bio-pesticides, bio-fungicides, plant protection equipment, brush cutters, harvesters’ etc. One-time financial assistance @ ₹10,000/- per hectare and training and capacity building are also provided to the Tea growers.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?

(i) Sale @ ₹1/- per seedling
(ii) One-time financial assistance @ ₹10,000/- per hectare.
(iii)50% subsidy on bio-fertilizers bio-pesticides, bio-fungicides, plant protection equipment, brush cutters, harvesters, etc.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers engaged in agriculture, possessing own or leased land of not exceeding 2 Ha/family can apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper along with supported land documents through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers on first come first serve basis.

faqs.question: Whom to contact?
faqs.answer:
1. District Horticulture Officer
2. Horticulture Development Officer

name: Financial Assistance for Purchase of Stake Net and its Accessories
description: “Financial Assistance for Purchase of Stake Net and its Accessories” is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. Stake net is a traditional method of catching fish practiced by the fishermen residing near the bank of the river. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided in the form of a subsidy on the purchase of stake nets and accessories for the fishermen. The applications are accepted only in offline mode.
benefits: For General CategorySubsidy of 50%
limited to ₹30
000 on a unit cost of ₹60
000 (excluding GST).For SC/ST/Woman CategorySubsidy of 60%
limited to ₹36
000 on a unit cost of ₹60
000 (excluding GST).NOTE: The beneficiary can avail of the scheme every 3 years.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a traditional fisherman by birth or profession.The applicant should be a resident of Goa.The applicant should have purchased a Stake Net and its Accessories.
required_documents: 1. Stake Allotment Permission issued by the Department of Fisheries.2. Stake Net Registration Certificate and License Certificate issued by the Department of Fisheries.3. Original Invoice from Authorized Dealers for the Purchase of Stake Net and its Accessories.4. Undertaking as per Proforma.5. Copy of Aadhaar Card.6. Mandate Form along with Bank Pass Book.

faqs.question: Where should the duly filled application form and documents be submitted?
faqs.answer: Submit the documents to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries, Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Patto Colony, Panaji Goa - 403 521, or to the official at BDO Office/ Sub-Offices of the Department of Fisheries.

faqs.question: How often can a beneficiary avail of the scheme, and what is the subsidy percentage for the SC/ST/Woman category?
faqs.answer: The scheme can be availed every 3 years, and the subsidy for SC/ST/Woman category is 60%, limited to ₹36,000.

faqs.question: What is the unit cost of a Stake Net and its Accessories under the "Financial Assistance for Purchase of Stake Net and its Accessories" scheme?
faqs.answer: The unit cost of a Stake Net and its Accessories is ₹60,000 (excluding GST).

faqs.question: What is the significance of the Stake Allotment Permission, and how can one obtain it?
faqs.answer: The Stake Allotment Permission is essential and can be acquired from the Department of Fisheries, Goa, prior to applying for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy amount be utilized for any other purpose apart from the purchase of Stake Net and its Accessories?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is specifically designated for the purchase of Stake Net and its Accessories and cannot be diverted for any other purpose.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for extending the deadline for submitting applications, and are there age-related criteria for applicants?
faqs.answer: There is no deadline for applications, and there are no age-related criteria. Applications can be submitted without any time constraints.

faqs.question: How is the subsidy amount disbursed to the beneficiaries, and what is the mode of payment?
faqs.answer: The approved subsidy amount is disbursed directly to the beneficiary's bank account through electronic transfer.

faqs.question: In the event of a change in the unit cost after application submission, how is the subsidy recalculated?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is fixed based on the unit cost at the time of application submission, and any subsequent changes do not impact the approved subsidy amount.

faqs.question: If a beneficiary has already availed of the scheme, can they reapply for another unit before the stipulated three-year gap?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme allows beneficiaries to apply every 3 years. Reapplication before this period is not permitted.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy be availed for multiple units of Stake Nets in a single application, and what are the considerations for such cases?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is applicable per unit, and multiple units can be covered in a single application, subject to meeting eligibility and documentation requirements.

faqs.question: What is the process for calculating the subsidy amount, considering the unit cost and applicable percentage?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is calculated as a percentage of the unit cost. For the General category, it's 50%, limited to ₹30,000, and for SC/ST/Woman category, it's 60%, limited to ₹36,000.

faqs.question: In situations where the applicant's address changes after submission, how should they communicate this to the department?
faqs.answer: Applicants should promptly inform the department in writing about any changes in their address, providing updated documentation as necessary.

name: Acharya Vidyasagar Gau Samvardhan Yojana
description: This scheme is for all categories of beneficiaries.The beneficiary must have a minimum of 1 acre of agricultural land for 5 animals and with the increase in the number of animals, the minimum agricultural land will be determined by increasing it proportionately.Priority to implementation of milk route.﻿Plan Unit CostThe animal owner can get the plan approved for minimum 5 or more animals and the maximum limit amount of the project is Rs. 10.00 lakhs.75 percent of the project cost will have to be received through bank loan and the balance amount will have to be arranged in the form of margin money assistance and the beneficiary's own contribution.Reimbursement of interest on 75 per cent of the unit cost or 5 per cent per annum (maximum Rs. 25,000 per annum) by the beneficiary on the loan availed from the bank, whichever is less, will be done by the department for 7 years. Interest on the remaining interest rate above 5 percent will have to be reimbursed by the beneficiary himself.﻿Margin money support - 25% of the project cost for general category subject to a maximum of Rs. 1.50 lakh33 percent of the project cost for SC/ST, maximum Rs. 2.00 lakhs.﻿

000 per annum) by the beneficiary on the loan availed from the bank
whichever is less
will be done by the department for 7 years. Interest on the remaining interest rate above 5 percent will have to be reimbursed by the beneficiary himself. ﻿

along with facilities for their feeding
cleaning
and medical care.The applicant must have a bank account in the name of the cow shelter or in their individual name.﻿

faqs.question: What Is The Objective Of This Scheme?
